item.title: 2023: Tinubu To Unveil A Muslim Running Mate Next Month
item.description: A former Chairman of the Lagos State chapter of the All Progressives Congress, Henry Ajomale has stated that the presidential candidate of the party, Bola Tinubu would unveil a Muslim running mate next month. Ajomale in an interview with Punch noted that Kabiru Masari would be replaced with another person by July 15. He further stated that the search for Vice Presidential candidate has been narrowed down to Borno, Kano, and Kaduna.

item.title: Damian Musk - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Rose to fame as one of the sons of business magnate Elon Musk. His mom is Elon's ex-wife Justine Wilson, and he is one of a trio of triplets the couple had, which includes Saxon and Kai. Before Fame His father rose to acclaim as the CEO of Tesla and CEO/founder of SpaceX.  Trivia His mom has published various novels for children and young adults, including 2007's Uninvited. Family Life His older brothers are Griffin Musk and Xavier Musk, who are twins.

item.title: Voting Ends At PDP Presidential Primary Election
item.description: Voting has ended in the presidential primary of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for the emergence of the 2023 presidential candidate of the party. Naija News reports the delegates from Abuja were the last to cast their votes last at the Abuja National Stadium venue of the PDP special national convention. Next up will be the sorting and counting of votes. Each of the aspirants had the opportunity to speak to the delegates before voting commenced in a final bid to convince them on why they should vote for him/her.

item.title: Sha'carri Richardson: 10 things to know about the American sprinter
item.description: Sha’Carri Richardson is a field sprinter competing in 100 metres and 200 metres. Her 2019 record of 10.75 seconds in the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) championship gave her the world attention. The record also made Sha’Carri one of the fastest women in the history of sprinting. In April 2021, she ran a new personal best (of 10.72), one of the best records in 2021. Sha’Carri Richardson is one of the few professional athletes who speak their minds on issues that can harm their brands.

Whichever way you look at the topic, names related to dying will, without a doubt, stand out from the rest. So, what are these unique baby names that mean death? Family Life She's from Panorama City, California, but is also of Filipino and Mexican descent.

item.title: Mr & Mrs Badoo: Check Out Olamide And His Gorgeous Girlfriend At Felabration 2013 (PHOTO)
item.description: The seventh edition of Felabration, the annual musical festival dedicated to late Nigerian Afrobeat music legend Fela Anikulapo-Kuti took off on 15 October, with great performance from a mix of old and new artistes led by Afro-Juju music star, Sir Shina Peters. Nigerian rapper/lyricist, Olamide Adedeji popularly called Olamide was among the Headliners for the event which held at the New Afrika Shrine. He was there with his girlfriend and decided to share a photo of them together.

item.title: We're Not Involved In Oyetola's Wife Convoy Attack
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Osun State has denied any involvement in the attack on the convoy of the state’s First Lady, Kafayat Oyetola. Naija News had earlier reported that the convoy was attacked on Friday at the Owode area of the state, and some of the First Lady’s aides sustained injuries. But in a statement on Saturday, the spokesman of the Osun PDP, Oladele Bamiji, said Oyetola’s escort caused the attack after he beat up a truck driver whose vehicle blocked the road.

item.title: Jinx - Age, Family, Bio
Jonathan Hosts Benue Governor, Ortom In Abuja
item.description: Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom on Tuesday visited former Nigerian President, Goodluck Jonathan in Abuja, the Federal Capital Territory (FCT). Naija News understands the two chieftains of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) met at the residence of the former President in Abuja. Explaining what was discussed during the meeting, the Chief Press Secretary to Governor Ortom, Nathaniel Ikyur said the discussion between the two leaders focused on how to strengthen the PDP ahead of the 2023 general elections.

item.title: Makazi ya kifahari ya mtangazaji Jeff Koinange kupigwa mnada kwa kushindwa kulipa deni
item.description: - Koinange, anadaiwa kukiuka sheria za kulipa deni la zaidi ya KSh130 milioni mwaka 2019 - Kampuni ya kupiga mnada ilichapisha tangazo hilo katika gazeti moja nchini ikiwataka wale ambao wanataka mali hiyo kutuma maombi - Nyumba hizo ambazo zimejengwa katika hekari 0.67 katika eneo la Kitusuru, pia zina vyumba vya wafanyakazi - Benki sasa inataka angalau kurejesha KSh65 milioni kutoka kwa nyumba zote mbili Mwanahabari tajika wa Citizen TV, Jeff Mwaura Koinange anakumbana na hatari ya mali yak kupigwa mnada kwa kushindwa kulipa deni.

item.title: Your Plan To Prosecute Igboho Will Fail
item.description: The Yoruba Council of Elders has condemned the plan by the Federal Government to prosecute Yoruba Nation agitator, Sunday Igboho, after his release by the Benin Republic authorities. In a statement on Tuesday, the Secretary-General of YCE, Kunle Olajide, said the Muhammadu Buhari government should explain the crimes committed by the separatist activist. Olajide said the planned prosecution of Igboho will fail, stressing that the government has been unfair in handling the case of the separatist.

item.title: Presidential Election ll Be Tough, But Tinubull Win Fayemi
item.description: The Governor of Ekiti State, Kayode Fayemi on Sunday said the 2023 presidential election will be tough. Fayemi, however, said the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) would come out victorious in the forthcoming election. According to the outgoing Governor of Ekiti State, electorates would be asked to assess the candidates based on their records. Fayemi stated this during an interview with Vanguard. He said, “On the impact (of Buhari’s performance) our party, we will have to explain ourselves to the Nigerian people.

The crossdresser took to his Instagram account to announce his new destination to his followers. He wrote: “I made to land of Royalty. item.title: 'If I Expose Lizzy Anjorin, Many Homes Will Be Broken'
item.description: Nollywood actress,Iyabo Ojo, has asserted that many homes will be broken and the internet will crash, if she decides to expose her colleague, Lizzy Anjorin. Naija News reports that the movie stars have been at loggerheads for some time and had constantly called out each other online over a series of accusations. Speaking during an Instagram live session with fans, Iyabo Ojo said she always considers home that will be affected if she exposes Lizzy.

item.title: Atiku Visits Obaseki In Benin, Discuss Strategies For Winning 2023 Election
item.description: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar was in Benin, the Edo State capital on Monday where he held discussions with the state governor, Godwin Obaseki. Naija News gathered the meeting between the two leaders discussed how the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) will emerge victorious at the 2023 general elections. Strategies on how to strengthen and reposition the party ahead of the 2023 general elections were said to have featured prominently in their discussions.

item.title: Ben Richardson - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Cinematographer, director, and producer who is best known for his work on the series Mare of Easttown. He directed the episodes titled, "The End Begins" and "The Price." He also worked on movies like The Fault in Our Stars, Beasts of the Southern Wild, Those Who Wish Me Dead, and Wind River. Before Fame He attended the Royal Holloway, University of London's media arts degree program before transitioning into the full-time world of professional cinematography.

item.title: David Wolfe - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Nutritionist and spokesman known for his promotion of alternative medicine and raw food diets. He has authored numerous books about his nutritional and medicinal philosophies including Superfoods: The Food and Medicine of the Future and Eating for Beauty. Before Fame Though he released his first book, Nature's First Law, The Raw Food Diet, in 1998, he didn't gain widespread fame until 2004 when he starred on the reality show Mad Mad House.

item.title: Fish Out Killers Of Kano Pastor
item.description: The Federal Government of Nigeria has been asked to fish out and take decisive action against the killers of Pastor Shuaibu Yohanna, in Kano. Naija News understands that the said pastor who was the spiritual head of the New Life for All Nations Church in Masu, a community in the Sumaila Local Government Area of Kano was murdered in his house by the yet to be identified assailants. The assailants according to reports, attacked the church building, its staff office and school, and also destroyed the pastor’s house during the incident.

item.title: Ice T - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Born Tracy Marrow, he is an iconic rapper and founder of the heavy metal band Body Count, which released the controversial track "Cop Killer" in 1992. Despite the anti-police message of his most infamous song, he went on to portray a police officer on the long-running NBC drama Law & Order: Special Victims Unit. Before Fame He was raised by his father and his father's housekeeper after the death of his mother.

item.title: Postecoglou Refuses To Rule Tottenham Out Of EPL Title Race
item.description: The manager of Tottenham Hotspur, Ange Postecoglou has refused to rule out his team out of the Premier League title race despite the team’s abysmal form in recent games. Postecoglou and his boys are currently occupying the 5th spot on the league table with 39 points in 20 games after spending weeks on top of the league table in the earlier stages of the campaign. In November and the first few days of December, Postecoglou’s team managed just one point from five games; however, they have subsequently won four of their five league games.

item.title: Chris Taylor (Baseball Player) - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: MLB shortstop who debuted with the Seattle Mariners in 2014, hitting .287 in 47 games. He became a member of the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2016 and was named 2017 NLCS MVP while helping lead the team to the World Series, where they were defeated by the Houston Astros. In 2020, he helped the Dodgers win the franchise's first World Series title in over 30 years.  Before Fame He played college baseball at the University of Virginia, where he also spent time at third base, and was a 2012 fifth round pick.

item.title: Klaus Fuchs - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: German spy who was caught providing information to the USSR about the Manhattan Project. Before Fame He graduated from University of Bristol in 1937 with a Ph.D. in Physics. Trivia He was awarded the National Prize of East Germany after serving 9 of his 14-year espionage sentence. Family Life He married Margarete Keilson in 1959 and had two sisters. Associated With As a spy, he worked with Albert Einstein and created the first hydrogen bomb.

item.title: Minister Gives Latest Update On Batch C Npower Recruitment, Stipend Payment For Exited Beneficiaries
item.description: Nigeria’s Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Hajia Sadiya Umar Farouq, has noted that the Npower Batch C recruitment which is currently at the review stage will be free and fair. She gave the assurance on Thursday during a meeting in Abuja with the state focal persons for the Social Investment Programmes. The Minister added that the government was working out modalities with a view to integrating beneficiaries of the batches A and B exited in June and July respectively.

item.description: A chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Yusuf Datti Baba-Ahmed, has joined the 2023 governorship race in Kaduna State. Naija News reports that Baba-Ahmed expressed interest to become the next Kaduna governor in 2023 on Sunday during an interview with reporters in Kaduna, the state capital. The former presidential aspirant said he was at the party secretariat to submit his letter of interest and inform the party leadership of his decision to run for the number one seat in the state.

item.title: Netflix's Romantic Comedy 'Resort to Love' Was Filmed on an Island Nation
item.description: Where was 'Resort to Love' filmed? Since the Netflix rom-com is filled with tropical scenery, fans think it was filmed in the Caribbean. Source: NetflixTechnology has come a long way in elevating the films and shows we watch on a daily basis. It also comes in handy to help studios save big bucks on their film budgets. However, nothing beats shooting a project in a real-life location. And with films like Netflix's rom-com Resort to Love that are expected to have tropical scenery, moving the project to a location with pristine beaches and a vacation-like vibe is a no-brainer.

item.title: FCCPC Asks Google, Apple Stores To Take Down Illegal Loan Apps
item.description: The Federal Competition and Consumer Protection Commission says it has reached out to digital distributors of mobile apps, Google Play Store and Apple Stores to clamp down on illegal loan apps on its platforms. The move, Naija News understands was made as a result of the outcry over abuse of policy and violations of human rights by some online money lenders. Most of the affected loan companies are observed to have emerged during the Coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Jane Goodall - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Iconic British primatologist, ethnologist, and anthropologist who lived with and studied the chimpanzees of East Africa. She is a UN Messenger of Peace and she has worked with Nonhuman Rights Project. Before Fame She was given a lifelike chimpanzee toy by her father when she was a child, which sparked her interest in apes. Trivia During her 45 year study of chimpanzees she observed that they had distinct personalities, were capable of rational thought and emotions like joy and sorrow, and demonstrated behaviors such as hugs, kisses, pats on the back, and even tickling.

Naija News has obtained the latest Npower news permanency for batch A and B beneficiaries amid the growing concern over the unpaid stipends due to the beneficiaries of the Federal Government’s social intervention scheme. This online news platform understands that the Minister of Humanitarian Affairs, Disaster Management and Social Development, Sadiya Farouq, recently said the exited and eligible N-power beneficiaries will be absorbed into government programmes and by private organisations for a permanent job.

item.title: 'Return to Amish' Has Returned for a Seventh Season Is the Show Scripted?
item.description: For years, rumors have been swirling around that 'Return to Amish' is scripted. Critics call the show fake and say it doesn't reflect Amish reality. Article continues below advertisement To the outside world, the lives of young men and women living in Amish country have been a complete mystery for centuries. But fast-forward to the present day, and TLC's network has begun airing shows like Breaking Amish and Return to Amish, which intend to offer viewers a look into their unique culture.

item.title: 2023: Osinbajo, Amaechi, Ngige, Others Will Withdraw During APC Presidential Primary
item.description: Former Presidential aide, Reno Omokri on Thursday claimed that some presidential aspirants under the All Progressives Congress would willingly withdraw from the race during the presidential primary of the ruling party. The APC had pegged its nomination and expression of interest forms for presidential aspirants at N100m, a decision which has not stopped top names in the party from purchasing the form. Nigerians had condemned the ruling party for putting a high price tag on its form, however, the party has seen more than 20 stakeholders express their intention to contest in the party’s primary election.

item.description: "Queen of the House" Singer Jody Miller Passed Away at 80 Years OldBy Chris BarillaPublished Oct. 7 2022, 11:30 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesIf you were listening to country, folk, or pop music in the 1960s and 1970s, odds are that you heard Jody Miller at one point or another. The crossover artist, most famous for her hit track "Queen of the House," left an undeniable mark on multiple genres and was a darling of both Capitol and Epic Records.

item.title: FG Orders Suspension Of Eleme-Onne East-West Road Construction
item.description: Reconstruction work along the Eleme-Onne portion of the East-West Road in Rivers State has been immediately suspended by the federal government. In an interview with reporters on Sunday in Port Harcourt, the Minister of Works, David Umahi, disclosed that the suspension directive was issued following the discovery that the contractor managing the project used inferior materials. Naija News reports that the He expressed disappointment over the poor progress of construction despite the government having paid an advance of N33 billion, even though he mentioned that he had viewed the work the day before (Saturday).

item.description: An Uber Eats customer says that the application charged him an extra 57 dollars when he used "group ordering" and won't refund him his money. Source: TikTokUber Eats customer (well, more than likely ex-Uber Eats customer) Alex Mutammara went viral on TikTok after posting a video delineating his negative experience with the popular food delivery service, stating that the random bill showed up on his credit card after using the application's group ordering function.

item.title: The Drummer Girl Challenge on TikTok Explained: Why it's Trending
item.description: The Drummer Girl Challenge on TikTok Previously Existed Under a Different NameBy Joseph AllenUpdated Oct. 8 2020, 2:41 p.m. ET Source: TikTokThe latest viral TikTok challenge isn't actually new. Although the Drummer Girl Challenge has taken the platform by storm in recent days, it's actually just a rebranding of a challenge that was popular once before. The last time it was popular, it was called the Electrical Tape Challenge. Both challenges have the same features, but one has much more potential for a raunchy ending.

item.title: 'The Handmaid's Tale' Season 1 Recap Plus Season 3 Spoilers!
item.description: Everything We Know About 'The Handmaid's Tale' Season 3By Lizzy RosenbergUpdated April 26 2021, 10:44 a.m. ET Source: HuluIf you're a fan of Hulu's Original Series, The Handmaid's Tale, you're most likely agonizing over the beginning of the third season, which officially debuts on Wednesday, June 5. The dystopian drama's previous season ended almost a full year ago (all the way back in July 2018!) so it's safe to say there is a lot of anticipation surrounding season three.

item.title: Ed Quinn - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Played the roles of Nathan Stark on Eureka, Stan in True Blood, Brent Ferguson in Desperate Housewives, and Gabriel Winters in Castle. He has starred as Hunter Franklin in the TV series The Oval since 2019. He has amassed over 50 acting roles throughout his ongoing career.  Before Fame He had his earliest television roles starting in 1999 with an appearance as Jeff in V.I.P. In 2000, he landed a starring role in Young Americans and also appeared on Dharma & Greg.

item.title: Samuel Eto'o Elected Cameroon FA President
item.description: Former Inter Milan and Barcelona striker Samuel Eto’o has been elected president of the Cameroon Football Federation (Fecafoot). Naija News reports that Eto’o, who polled 43 votes, defeated the incumbent president, Seidou Mbombo Njoya, who scored 31 votes. Eto’o was acting as the global ambassador for the Qatar 2022 World Cup while Njoya is currently the fourth vice-president of the Confederation of African Football. Seven candidates had planned to contest the elections, but five of them pulled out on the morning of the elections.

item.title: Aprili 30: Watu 17 ndio wamefariki kutokana na coronavirus
item.description: Kenya imefikisha watu 17 idadi ya walioangamizwa na ugonjwa wa coronavirus tangu utangazwe Machi 13. Katibu Msimamizi Rashid Aman Alhamisi, Aprili 30, alisema idadi hiyo imefikia hapo baada ya watu wengine wawili kufariki. Habari Nyingine: Jamaa alimwa plotini kumpa mke wa mwenzake hela Aidha visa vya maambukizi vimefikia watu 396 baada ya wengine 12 kupatwa na virusi hivyo saa 24 zilizopita. Wagonjwa hao 12 walipatikana baada ya watu 777 kupimwa maambukizi ya ugonjwa huo.

item.title: EACC detectives unearth fraud at Raila's company
item.description: - Detectives have exposed details of an undercover operation that discovered fishy ethanol dealings associated with a company owned by Raila Odinga's company - The EACC detectives followed vehicles that had left the company in Kisumu to a warehouse in Embakasi EACC and Kenya Revenue Authority officials raided a go-down in Embakasi, Nairobi after noticing a syndicate of illegal ethanol business. READ ALSO: Government closes down Raila Odinga school The officers revealed that they had been conducting an undercover operation in which they trailed trucks as they left Spectre International Ltd in Kisumu, a firm belonging to Raila's family.

item.title: Jaime Pressly - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: American actress and model best known for starring as Joy Turner on the television series My Name is Earl. Before Fame She spent 11 years training in gymnastics and dancing. Trivia She was nominated for Emmy Awards for her work on the hit sitcom My Name Is Earl. Family Life She dated DJ Eric Cubeechee, and in 2007 they welcomed a son named Dezi James. The couple split in 2008. She married Simran Singh in 2009, but the couple divorced in 2011.

item.title: Labour Party Speaks On Its Supporters Threatening Tribunal Judges
item.description: The Labour Party (LP) has refuted claims that its supporters threatened judges reviewing the petition of Peter Obi against the election results favouring Bola Tinubu. According to National Publicity Secretary, Obiora Ifoh, the All Progressives Congress (APC) has concocted the story to tarnish the LP’s image and stir unrest. He described a circulating photo as a ploy “to distract from APC’s open intimidating remarks.” LP highlighted remarks by Tinubu’s legal team, which suggested potential chaos if Tinubu’s election was overturned.

item.title: Diamond Platnumz lover Tanasha Donna confirms son was born on lover Diamond Platnumz's birthday
item.description: While everyone else was looking forward to a lavish birthday party for Tanzania's Bongo Star Diamond Platnumz, he was busy walking up and down the corridors of a maternity ward. Being among pioneers of October babies, Diamond added another year to his life on Wednesday October 2, and that was not all, he also welcomed the newest member to his family. item.title: Fani-Kayode Takes Personal Decision On APC Muslim-Muslim Ticket Bid
item.description: Former Minister of Aviation, Femi Fani-Kayode has reacted to the trending argument over an alleged move by the All Progressives Congress, APC presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, to choose a Muslim running mate for the 2023 presidential election. Naija News reports that the Muslim-Muslim ticket bid has generated a barrage of reactions on and off social media as citizens express worries that it would be an unfair move considering the religious status of the country.

item.title: Kenyans Ask Guardian Angel to Avoid Naysayers, Love Older Fiance without Fear
item.description: - Guardian Angel surprised his lover Esther with a proposal on her birthday date, and she could not hold back her tears - The power couple has always been criticised over their age difference, but that has never deterred them from loving each other - In a recent interview with TUKO.co.ke, Pastor Burale asked Kenyans to stop criticising celebrities who marry spouses younger or older than them - Burale said that as long as somebody is of legal age, they shouldn't be trolled because of who they choose to settle down with PAY ATTENTION: Help us change more lives, join TUKO.

item.title: MoviePass Is Officially Dead Here's Which Alternatives to Use Instead
item.description: MoviePass Is Officially Dead and Filing for Bankruptcy — Here's What to Use InsteadBy Jacqueline GualtieriUpdated Jan. 29 2020, 8:11 p.m. ET Source: istockWe all knew this day would come. Although users declared MoviePass dead long ago, it appears that the final nail in the coffin has officially arrived. The subscription service that was once raved about has declared Chapter 7 bankruptcy. Unlike Chapter 11, which allows companies to be reorganized and try again, this version of bankruptcy means that the company is dissolving and everyone has resigned.

item.title: Olivia Olson - Age, Family, Bio
Terrorism: Why Tukur Mamu Was Arrested
item.description: Recall that terrorists on the 28th of March attacked an Abuja/Kaduna-bound train and abducted 100 passengers. The terrorists, however, released the passengers in batches, while ransom exchanged hands in the process of their release. To secure the release of the victims, Islamic cleric, Ahmed Gumi visited the terrorists in their hideout and pleaded with the government to facilitate the requests of the bandits. The relationship between Gumi and the bandits saw the government and security agencies commence a discreet investigation.

item.title: Everything to Know About Season 14 of 'Apex Legends'

The free-to-play title based on the Titanfall franchise has brought plenty of original characters to the game to offer variety to its 100 million players.

item.title: Gandujes Wife Shuns EFCC's Invitation, Attends Sons Graduation In UK (Photos)
item.description: The first lady of Kano State, Hafsat Ganduje has shunned the invitation of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission and instead attended the graduation of one of her sons in the United Kingdom. The anti-graft agency had invited the wife of the Kano State Governor, Abdullahi Ganduje over alleged involvement in a land fraud scandal. As earlier published by Naija News, Hafsat was invited by the commission following a petition by her eldest son, Abdulazeez.

item.title: PDP Blames Buhari For Kaduna Airport Attack By Terrorists, Says Nowhere Is Safe Again In Nigeria
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in its reaction to Saturday’s attack by bandit terrorists on Kaduna Airport has blamed it on the inefficiency of the President Muhammadu Buhari-led government. The PDP in a statement on Sunday lamented that terrorists, bandits, and other criminals have taken over every part of the country and the government and security agencies appear helpless. It will be recalled that troops of the Nigerian military on Saturday clashed with bandit terrorists forcing the closure of the Kaduna International Airport.

By Distractify StaffUpdated July 18 2024, 4:11 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesBeloved comedian and television actor, best known for his stand-up act and his extremely popular sitcoms, Bob Newhart, died on Thursday, July 18. item.title: Mitchel Musso - Age, Family, Bio
Supreme Court Upolds INECs De-registration Of Political Parties
item.description: The Supreme Court of Nigeria, on Friday upheld the decision of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to de-register 22 political parties. The electoral body had scrapped and banned the political parties from contesting in elections in 2020. Justice Ejembi Eko in his ruling on Friday, voided and set aside the judgment of the Court of Appeal which had nullified the de-registration. According to Justice Eko, the Court of Appeal ruled in favour of the affected parties without hearing from other parties in the matter.

Peter Obi, Yusuf Datti Visit Babangida (Photos)
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi on Sunday visited former Nigerian Head of State, Ibrahim Badamosi Babangida (IBB). Obi visited Babangida at his residence in Minna, Niger State in the company of his running mate, Yusuf Datti Baba-Ahmed, Naija News reports. The LP candidate made the disclosure via a post on the micro-blogging site, Twitter. The visit is understood to be part of consultations for their 2023 presidential ambition.

item.title: Nigerian Newspapers Daily Front Pages Review
item.description: Naija News looks at the top happenings making headlines on the front pages of Nigeria’s national newspapers today Monday, February, 14th 2022. According to The PUNCH, residents of Abuja and neighbouring states of Niger and Nasarawa are still facing tough times sourcing for Premium Motor Spirit, popularly called petrol, with the commodity selling for as high as N400/litre by black marketers. Petroleum marketers, yesterday, said the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) Limited is yet to evacuate adulterated petroleum from fuel stations as motorists jostle to purchase premium motor spirit.

item.title: Nigerians React As BBNaija's Nina Reportedly Remarries In America
item.description: Nigerians on social media have reacted following the alleged second marriage of former Big Brother Naija housemate, Nina Ivy. Naija News reports the Imo State-born TV reality star tied the knot with an African-American, Chris Miller. According to reports, the couple dated for seven months after they first met in 2021, before finally tying the knot privately in a court in the United States of America. Following the union, the reality TV star has since changed her name on all social media platforms to the husband’s name, Nina Ivy Miller.

item.title: Rico Swavey's Death: 'He Is A Wreck, I'm Tired Of Consoling Him'

Naija News earlier reported that many BBNaija stars, friends and family members held a night of tribute on Wednesday in honour of the late singer and actor. Recall that the reality TV star passed away last Thursday morning, days after he was involved in a ghastly accident in Lagos.

item.title: COVID-19: Wizara ya Afya Yathibitisha Maambukizi Mengine 965
item.description: Watu 965 wameambukizwa Covid-19 katika saa 24 zilizopita kutoka kwa sampuli 7,311 zilizopimwa. Idadi ya watu walioambukizwa Covid-19 nchini Kenya sasa ni 153,488. Tangu Machi jumla ya sampuli zilizopimwa imefika 1,618,990. Habari Nyingine: Embakasi: Barobaro Mtundu Alazimika Kukesha Kwenye Veranda Kati ya visa vilivyotangazwa leo, wagonjwa 907 ni Wakenya nao 58 ni wageni. Wagonjwa 560 ni wa kiume na 405 ni wa kike. Mgonjwa mwenye umri wa mdogo ni mtoto wa miezi mitatu naye mkongwe zaidi akiwa na miaka .

item.title: Gunmen Kidnap Former Deputy Governor In Nasarawa
item.description: Unknown gunmen have reportedly kidnapped a former Deputy Governor of Nasarawa State, Professor Onje Gye-Wado. Reports reaching Naija News confirmed that the gunmen abducted the politician from his residence in Gwagi village of Wamba Local Government Area of the state on Friday morning. Confirming the development in a press release, the state Police Public Relations Officer, DSP Ramhan Nansel, said the assailants forcefully broke into Gye-Wado’s residence this morning. Nansel noted that the command operatives in collaboration with other security personnel have since launched a search to rescue the victim unhurt.

Kelechi shared a video of Saka’s arrival on Instagram on Wednesday, saying “Local man and Bukayo Saka just touched down Lagos, Nigeria. Naija we outside,” he wrote. item.title: No, Biden Wasn't Wired During His First Presidential Debate With Trump
item.description: Was Joe Biden Wearing a Wire During the First Presidential Debate With Trump?By Mustafa GatollariUpdated Sept. 30 2020, 3:46 p.m. ET Source: CNN video screengrabPresidential debates have always been interesting affairs where candidates vying for the position of commander in chief discuss policies they plan to implement while throwing in subtle, or not-so-subtle, jabs at their opposition. item.title: 'Democracy Working' - UK Speaks On Outcome Of Anambra Election
item.description: The United Kingdom Government has described the outcome of the just concluded Anambra governorship election as credible and peaceful. Recall that the candidate of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA), Chukwuma Soludo, who won 19 out of 21 Local Council in Anambra State, was declared the winner of the election by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). In a statement released via its Twitter page on Thursday, the UK government stated that the outcome of the election shows that the people of Anambra have demonstrated resilience and a commitment to democracy.

item.title: Appeal Court Takes Decision On Sack Of Ebonyi Governor, Umahi And Deputy
item.description: The Court of Appeal sitting in Enugu State has upheld  the ruling of an Ebonyi State High Court which denied the sack from office of David Umahi and Kelehi Igwe as Governor and Deputy Governor of Ebonyi State respectively. The appellate court on Friday in a unanimous judgement read by Justice Alfa Belgore, dismissed the suit bought before it for being inconsistent with the Constitution and extant laws of the country.

item.description: A purported theft of an undisclosed sum in US Dollars has reportedly rocked the Office of the Deputy Governor of Nasarawa State. The Pokémon franchise holds a special place in the lives of many of its players, whether they started playing the games on the original Game Boy console or watched Ash Ketchum on his journey through the Kanto region. Pokémon GO has more than 75 million active players years after its release, and trainers from all over the world attended the in-person New York City Pokémon GO Fest in August 2023.

item.title: Courts Orders Interim Forfeiture Of 40 Landed Properties Belonging To Ekweremadu
item.description: A Federal High Court sitting in Abuja has today ordered an interim forfeiture of 40 landed properties belonging to former Deputy Senate President, Ike Ekweremadu. Naija News reports that the High Court’s judgement followed an ex-parte motion filed and moved by Ibrahim Buba on behalf of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC). Ekweremadu, is currently in custody in the United Kingdom, over allegations of organ harvesting. Justice Inyang Ekwo, who presided over the suit numbered, FHC/ABJ/CS/1242/2022, ordered the anti-graft agency to publish the interim forfeiture order of the properties in a national daily within seven days from the date the order was given.

item.title: El-Rufai Never Said Tinubu Was Too Old To Be President APC
item.description: The North-West All Progressives Congress (APC), presidential campaign council has cleared the air on a comment linked to the Kaduna State Governor, Nasir El-Rufai. The campaign council on Monday noted that El-Rufai never said the presidential candidate of the party, Bola Tinubu is too old for the presidency. The spokesperson of the council, Muhammad Shehu Molash in his reaction to the claim that El-Rufai said so in a video, accused mischief makers of projecting fake news.

item.title: GEJ Fulfills Presidential Promise, Revives Railway System
item.description: President Goodluck Jonathan said that he has fulfilled his promise to revive a moribund railway system in Nigeria. According to Jonathan’s Facebook post, when he came into office as President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria on 6 May 2010, he vowed to himself to put Nigerian railways back on track, as he believed that it offered the most inexpensive mode of transportation for the people. And four years later, the President is happy to announce that this promised has been fulfilled.

item.title: Sunday Igboho Would Have Been Doomed If He Was Captured Like Nnamdi Kanu, He Won't Return Until Buha
item.description: Yoruba Nation agitator Sunday Adeyemo, also known as Sunday Igboho, won’t return to Nigeria until the end of the President Muhammadu Buhari’s administration. Naija News reports that this was disclosed by one of his lawyer Olusegun Falola. He said the agitator is staying away from the hostile environment created by Buhari, adding that his stay in Benin Republic is a blessing in disguise. Speaking on a radio interview monitored by The Nation, Falola claimed that Sunday Igboho would have been left for the worse if the Buhari government had succeeded in capturing him like the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu.

item.title: What are the types of socialization in sociology?
item.description: What is socialization? What do you know about the different types of socialization? Every day, we communicate with people and notice that some of them are more communicative, while others hardly find a common language. Naturally, much depends on a person’s character, but what about finding a reason of the level of a person’s socialization? Socialization definition is the ability of a person to adapt to the surrounding social environment. It is the process of establishing a person’s behaviour, habits, skills that will help them to find a common language with the people around more easily.

item.title: ADC Expels Kachikwu, Others From Party
item.description: The presidential candidate of the African Democratic Congress (ADC), Dumebi Kachikwu has been expelled from the party. Nwosu revealed that Kachikwu was expelled from the party due to anti-party activities and violation of the party’s constitution. The chairman of the party said the seven-man panel set up by the party which sat for six days submitted its report on Thursday.

item.title: Buhari Disappointed In Ortom, Blasts The Benue State Governor
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has lambasted Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom after the Governor called out the President for the way he is handling the nation’s security challenges. He accused Ortom of attempting to cause more divide along ethnic, political, and religious divides rather than cooperate with the federal government to implement ideas and solutions.

item.title: Police Arrest Three Women Assisting Bandits In Katsina
item.description: Men of the Nigeria Police Force have arrested three women in Katsina State for allegedly assisting bandits with petrol. Naija News understands the suspects were apprehended along Jibia-Katsina road while attempting to smuggle the petroleum products in their bags to the bandits.

item.title: Security Beefed Up At National Assembly As Legislative Aides Protest
item.description: Security agents have beefed up security around the National Assembly over the planned protest of legislative aides. It was gathered that security personnel including anti-riot and regular policemen, Department of State Services (DSS) personnel and Sergeant-at-Arms have surrounded the complex. Doors leading to the foyer at the White House from the Senate and House of Representatives chambers have not only been shut but being guarded by security operatives. This is due to the planned protest of Legislative aides, under the auspices of Salary Arrears Affected Legislative Aides (SAALA).

item.title: God Will Not Give You A Burden That You Cannot Carry

item.title: Buhari Travels To London For Medical Checkup, To Attend UNEP Summit In Kenya
item.description: The President of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari on Tuesday (today) would depart Abuja for Nairobi where he would be attending the Commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the United Nations Environmental Programme, scheduled for 3rd – 4th March 2022 in Nairobi, Kenya. President Buhari after the meeting in Kenya will travel to London, the United Kingdom for a medical check-up which will last for two weeks. item.title: IGP Approach Court To Set Aside Jail Term Over Contempt
item.description: A Federal High Court in Abuja, on Tuesday, sentenced the Inspector General of Police, Usman Baba to three months in prison for disobeying a court order. The ruling was passed by Justice Mobalaji Olajuwon following a suit filed by a police officer, Patrick Okoli, who was unlawfully and compulsorily retired from the Nigerian Police Force. Baba in his reaction to the court ruling approached the court to file a motion to set aside the contempt proceeding and committal order.

item.title: Rabiu Kwankwaso directs supporters to leave APC
item.description: Kwankwaso tells supporters to dump APC. A former governor of Kano State, Senator Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso, has reportedly directed his supporters in the state to dump the All Progressives Congress (APC) for the People’s Democratic Party (PDP). His nephew, Musa Iliyasu Kwankwaso, who is also the Commissioner for Special Duties in Kano State, disclosed that the former governor had asked his supporters to join the PDP ahead of the forthcoming local council election in the state.

item.title: APC Reportedly Intensifies Plot To Oust INEC Chairman, Recruit Senators
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) has allegedly intensified plots to instigate the National Assembly to pass a vote of no confidence which could lead to the suspension or removal of the chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), Professor Mahmood Yakubu. According to Saturday Sun, some politicians are uncomfortable with the INEC chairman’s insistence on wholly deploying technology in the conduct of the elections. It was gathered that those opposed to Yakubu are putting pressure on some senators to recommend his suspension or removal to President Muhammadu Buhari.

item.description: No fewer than nine people have reportedly been killed and nine others brutally injured by bandits, during an attack on Gindin Dutse Makyali village of Kufana district in Kajuru Local Government Area of Kaduna State. Naija News learned that the tragic incident occurred in the early hours of Sunday, very close to a military checkpoint. Although the Kaduna State Police authorities are yet to confirm the incident, a community leader, Moses Musa, in an interview with Channels Television, said that the bandits invaded the community around 5 am as the residents were still asleep and immediately started shooting sporadically.

item.title: No State Governor Hoarded COVID-19 Palliatives
item.description: The Nigeria Governors’ Forum has debunked the reports that palliatives uncovered by hoodlums in warehouses across the nation were intentionally hoarded by state governors. According to the NGF in a statement on Monday, October 26, the reports making rounds in the media about the hoarding of the palliatives were untrue, insisting that the food items were stored purposely for members of the public, most especially the vulnerable. Naija News understands that hoodlums in Lagos State and some other states in the last week uncovered hoarded palliatives meant for distribution to Nigerians in order to ameliorate their sufferings during the first wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: APC Speaks On Goodluck Jonathan's Membership
item.description: The All Progressives Congress has broken silence on the report making rounds that the former president Goodluck Jonathan has dumped the Peoples Democratic Party for the ruling party. The Chairman of the Bayelsa State Chapter of the APC, Dennis Otiotio on Tuesday stated that Jonathan has not joined the party. He, however, said the ruling party is willing to receive the former president into their party ahead of the 2023 general elections.

item.title: Osunbor Urges Tinubu To Intervene In Edo APC Crisis
item.description: A leading figure in the All Progressives Congress (APC) 2024 gubernatorial primary in Edo State, Oserheimen Osunbor, has made a public appeal to President Bola Tinubu, requesting his intervention in the party’s escalating crisis. item.title: 1981 Chinese Zodiac | Metal Rooster
item.description: Although given many positive qualities, the personality of the Metal Rooster does not come without its fair share of challenges. At times, the Metal Rooster has trouble keeping an open mind towards the opinions of others. Similarly, they may struggle to compromise or show understanding towards conflicting beliefs. Additionally, the introspective Metal Rooster can often become to focused on their thoughts, avoiding actual application of their ideals. To overcome their difficulties, the Metal Rooster is encouraged to be less close-minded and more action-oriented.

item.title: Kipchumba Murkomen Says Uhuru Not Sincere in Lifting Cessation of Movement in 5 Counties
item.description: - Senator Murkomen said the reopening of Nairobi, Machakos, Nakuru, Kiambu, and Kajiado counties was informed by Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) politics and not pleas by Kenyans - While lifting the cessation of movement in the mentioned counties, the president said empirical evidence showed a reduction in coronavirus positivity rate - The head of state also revised curfew hours in the zoned area to commence at 10:00 pm and end at 4:00 am from 8 pm with effect from mid-night May 1

item.description: Vice President Kashim Shettima has said the Bola Tinubu government is on the right path to returning Nigeria to greatness. The vice president said President Tinubu would soon revive the economy and the future would be brighter with shared commitment, mutual respect and open dialogue. Shettima, who was represented by his spokesman, Stanley Nkwocha, said this on Saturday night during the Daily Sun Newspaper Awards in Lagos. He, however, emphasized the crucial role the media must play in achieving this goal, calling for collaboration and a shared commitment to national progress.

item.title: How Gana Stopped Convoy, Switched Cars Before Arrest, Killing By Soldiers Eyewitnesses
item.description: The reason behind the death of Terwase Akwaza, also known as Gana, unfolds daily as more facts emerge. Information gathered has revealed that the most wanted criminal in Benue State swapped cars in the government convoy that was taking him and other repentant militias to Makurdi, the state capital. Eyewitnesses who spoke with Punch, noted that the convoy took off from Katsina-Ala at about 1:30pm on Tuesday, Gana was in one of the official vehicles of one of the paramount rulers.

item.title: See What Mercy Aigbe Says About Her Alleged Romance With Gov. Rotimi Amaechi
item.description: There were rumours about popular Nollywood actress Mercy Aigbe-Gentry having love affair with Rivers State governor, Rotimi Amaechi. I only know him to be Rivers State governor, and from his performances so far, he has proved himself to be very sensitive when it comes to the plight of his people.

item.title: Tinubu Sets Up Economic Advisory Committee
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has set up an economic advisory committee to chart a pathway for the economic growth and development of the nation. The president made this known on Sunday after meeting with some members of the Organised Private Sector at the State House, Abuja. President Tinubu stated that the committee comprises of the federal government, sub-nationals and the private sector. Tinubu disclosed that the goal is to advise the government on additional efforts in stabilising the economy and ensuring the best economic future for Nigerians.

item.title: Allu Arjun - Age, Family, Bio

item.title: Deputy Governor of Ekiti State Mrs Funmilayo Olayinka Is dead
item.description: The deputy Governor of Ekiti state, Mrs Olufunmilayo Adunni Olayinka is dead. She passed away after a battle with cancer. A statement signed by the state’s Commissioner for Information; Tayo Ekundayo, announced the demise of Mrs Olayinka, late Saturday night. “It is with sadness but with gratitude to God, the passing of the State Deputy Governor, H.E. Mrs Olufunmilayo Adunni Olayinka, aged 52, after a tough but courageous battle with cancer” the statement read.

item.title: Good News For Nigerians As House Of Reps Seek To Act On Hike Of Food Prices
item.description: A bill has been brought forward In the House of Representatives seeking to combat the present food hike in the economy. According to the bill which was exclusively obtained by Vanguard every Nigerian should be given a right to food and the Federal Government has to put measures in place to make sure the right is brought to fruition. The chief whip of the house, Mohammed Monguno is set to seek an alteration of the constitution through the bill which is titled: “An Act to Alter the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, 1999 to make provisions for Right to Food and Security in Nigeria.

item.description: Good morning Nigeria. Welcome to the Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today, Wednesday, 28th February 2024 President Bola Tinubu has defended the decision of his administration to end the fuel subsidy regime in Nigeria. According to the President, fuel subsidy had to go because it was causing a strain on the economy, leading to inefficiencies and, most importantly, hindering Nigeria’s ability to invest in critical areas of energy security.

item.title: ASUU STRIKE: FG Calls University Lecturers to Be Realistic
item.description: The Federal Government on September 4, 2013, Wednesday, rebuked university lecturers, ASUU, over their ongoing indefinite strike. Mr. Labaran Maku, the Minister of Information, announced the government’s attitude to the strike while speaking to the reporters on September 4, 2013, Wednesday, after the weekly meeting of the Executive Council of the Federation, FEC, in Abuja. “This country belongs to all of us, if we all insist that every sector problem must be completely solved, we will down tools we will not work, then the country will stop working,” he said.

item.title: 2023: It's Atikus Turn To Become President
item.description: The National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Senator Iyorchia Ayu, has said it is the turn of the party’s presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar, to become President in 2023. Naija News reports that Ayu stated this through his media aide, Simon Imobo-Tswam, during an interview with journalists on Tuesday in Abuja. Imobo-Tswam expressed confidence that the PDP candidate will win the 2023 election and all its candidates would emerge victorious in the forthcoming polls.

item.title: Tinubu, Others Should Also Make Sacrifices For Nigerians Peter Obi
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP) in the February 25 election, Peter Obi, has said that the situation in the country requires those in authority to lead by example. Obi said Nigerian leaders could not continue to preach to the people to make sacrifices without sacrificing themselves, saying that the people are suffering following the increases in the pump price of petrol and electricity tariff. He stated this on Thursday while speaking at the funeral service of the late Dean of the Church of Nigeria, Anglican Communion, Most Rev Maxwell Anikwenwa, at St Faith’s Anglican Cathedral, Awka, the Anambra capital.

item.title: El Salvador | Famous Birthdays
item.description: A country in Central America bordered by Honduras and Guatemala.  From the late 19th to the mid-20th century, it endured political and economic instability. The Salvadoran Civil War was fought between the military-led government backed by the United States, and a coalition of guerrilla groups from 1979 to 1992. Trivia Known as the land of volcanoes, El Salvador has frequent earthquakes and volcanic activity. Its national bird is the Torogoz. Coffee cultivated in the western part of El Salvador is world famous.

item.description: Nigerian Nobel Laureate, Prof Wole Soyinka, has reacted to the BBC documentary exposing the alleged atrocities of the late founder of the Synagogue Church Of Nations (SCOAN), Pastor Temitope Balogun, famously known as TB Joshua. Naija News reports that the controversial clergyman who died on June 5, 2021, made headlines in January 2024, after BBC published a 3-part investigative documentary detailing the atrocities and sexual crimes committed by the cleric.

item.title: Nunez Breaks Record, Becomes Fastest Player In Premier League History
item.description: Liverpool forward, Darwin Nunez, has broken the record for the quickest player in Premier League history. Naija News recall that the Uruguayan striker moved to the English club for a fee of £64.1million, making him potentially the most expensive signing in Liverpool’s history. Liverpool’s record-breaking signing, Darwin Nunez, may not have had the best season opener, but he still broke the record to become the fastest player in Premier League history.

item.title: Rudy Gobert - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: All-star center nicknamed "The Stifle Tower" who made his NBA debut with the Utah Jazz after being drafted in the first round of the 2013 NBA draft. In 2014, he won bronze at the FIBA World Cup as a member of the French national team. He was named the NBA Defensive Player of the Year in 2018, 2019 and 2021.  Before Fame He got his start playing basketball at his hometown club, JSC Saint-Quentin. He debuted with Cholet Basket in the French League in 2010.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Monday, 31st July, 2023
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to the Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today, Monday, 31st July 2023. President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has appointed a Special Investigator to probe the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and key Government Business Entities (GBEs). This is coming as the suspended Governor of the apex bank, Godwin Emefiele is been detained at the office of the Department of State Services (DSS), Naija News reports.

item.title: You Are Not Fit To Hold Any Public Office, Leave Buhari Alone
item.description: Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom is a very unprincipled man who is only motivated by the lust for personal gains, the presidency has declared. This is why he has changed political parties several times during his ‘undistinguished career.’ These are part of the submissions made by the presidency on Wednesday evening in a response to recent attacks by the Governor against President Muhammadu Buhari and his administration. Naija News recalls most recently, Ortom labelled Buhari as the worst President to ever rule Nigeria, adding that the President is grossly incapable of managing the affairs of the country.

item.description: Personal trainer best known as one of the main trainers of the Australian version of The Biggest Loser. item.title: Tinubu Present As Buhari Supervises First Oil Drilling In Northern Nigeria
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Tuesday supervised the first oil drilling in the Northern part of Nigeria. All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential candidate, Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu, was on sight at the historical event some other top government officials witnessed today, Naija News reports. The Oil Prospecting Lease (OPL) 809 and 810 at the Kolmani oil field site are located in Bauchi and Gombe States. The Kolmani Integrated Development Project phase I is expected to entail an in-situ Oil Refinery of up to 120k barrels/day capacity, a gas processing plant of up to 500 million standard cubic feet per day, a Power Plant of up to 300MW capacity and a Fertilizer Plant of 2,500 tons per day, President Buhari’s aide, Bashir Ahmad revealed.

item.title: Kidnapping Increased After Tinubu Took Office
item.description: The 2023 presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP),Peter Obi, has said the kidnappings of Nigerians increased rapidly after President Bola Tinubu took over office on May 29, 2023. In a post via his official X handle, Obi lamented the kidnappings and killings of innocent citizens in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) and other parts of the country. The former Governor of Anambra stated that the government is rewarding those who paid to get Tinubu elected rather than spending money to tackle insecurity in the nation.

item.description: Apex Igbo socio-cultural organization, Ohanaeze Ndigbo Worldwide has berated a former presidential aspirant, Adamu Garba over a statement seeking the University of Nigeria, Nsukka (UNN) be renamed after the late Queen Elizabeth II. item.title: Osinbajo, Akeredolu Sympathises With Gov Abiodun Over His Father's Death (Photos)
item.description: The Vice President of Nigeria, Yemi Osinbajo, on Friday visited the Governor of Ogun State, Dapo Abiodun to sympathise with him over the death of his father, Pa Emmanuel Abiodun. Osinbajo had the company of the Governor of Ondo State, Rotimi Akeredolu and the Speaker of the House of Representatives, Femi Gbajabiamila. The Vice President while speaking in Iperu, the hometown Governor Abiodun said he was in the town to deliver the condolence message of President Muhammadu Buhari.

item.title: CBN Slashes FX Duty Rates
item.description: The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) has slashed the exchange rate used to calculate import duties. The rate was slashed by 5.3%, Naija News understands. The development was posted on the official trade portal of the Nigeria Customs Service. The reduction comes after a period of relative stability in the exchange rate between the Naira and the United States dollar. Naija News reports that the rate for calculating customs duties was ₦1,544.

item.title: PIB: How Borno Governor, Traditional Ruler Stopped Lawmaker From Backing 5% Equity For Host Communit
item.description: The leader of the minority caucus in the House of Representatives, Hon. Ndudi Elumelu, has revealed how Governor Babagana Zulum of Borno State stopped a lawmaker from backing the 5% equity for host communities in the PIB. Recall that President Muhammadu Buhari had last week signed the controversial Petroleum Industry Bill (PIB) into law. The Petroleum Industry Act, which pegged equity for host communities at 3%, provides a legal, governance, regulatory and fiscal framework for the Nigerian petroleum industry, the development of host communities, and related matters.

item.title: What Was Jeremiah Green's Cause of Death? What We Know
item.description: Modest Mouse Drummer Jeremiah Green Dies at Age 45By Anna GarrisonPublished Jan. 3 2023, 10:31 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesDrummer and Modest Mouse co-founder Jeremiah Green has died at the age of 45. The band announced his death on Dec. 31, 2022, with a touching tribute on Instagram. Jeremiah co-founded Modest Mouse in 1992 with frontman Isaac Brock and bassist Eric Judy. Although Jeremiah briefly left the band in 2003, he returned in 2004 and remained with the band for their subsequent albums.

item.title: Girl Finds Out She's Adopted in Science Class
item.description: Thanks To Her Science Class, This Girl Made A Crazy Discovery About Her FamilyBy Mustafa GatollariUpdated Oct. 8 2018, 11:38 p.m. ET Source: gettyScience class was never my forte. Now I could chalk it up to it "just not being my thing" but the truth is, because I was told I was a "creative" kid growing up, whatever that meant, and I loved reading after I finally learned how to do it, I was more concerned with sneaking chapters of works of fiction than learning about the krebs cycle.

item.title: President Tinubu To Send Second Batch Of Ministerial Nominees To Senate Today
item.description: A reliable source in the Senate has disclosed that President Bola Tinubu will sends the second batch of his ministerial nominees to the Senate for screening on Wednesday (today). Naija News reports that the president, through his Chief of Staff, Femi Gbajabiamila presented his first batch of ministerial nominees last Thursday to meet the constitutional deadline. Recall the Gbajabiamila had promised that the President would be sending a second list of about 14 more nominees.

item.title: Robert Mugabe's Widow Grace in Court to Block Exhumation of Husband's Remains
item.description: Robert Mugabe died on Friday, September 6, 2019, in Singapore, where he had been receiving treatment since April 2019He was buried in his rural village of Kutama, where his mother was interredA traditional court ruled his widow, Grace Mugabe, buried him improperly and ordered his remain exhumed for reburial at the national shrineThe former first lady and her children have opposed the verdictGrace Mugabe, the widow of the late former Zimbabwe president Robert Mugabe, has moved to court to block an order to exhume her husband's remains.

item.title: Tinubu Postponed His U.S Trip, He Wasn't Denied Visa
item.description: Senate Chief Whip, Orji Uzor Kalu has debunked rumours that the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, wasn’t denied a visa to the United States. According to him, Tinubu only postponed his travel to the US but wasn’t denied a visa as speculated. Naija News gathered that Kalu, in a Facebook post on Saturday, said Tinubu would be welcomed with open arms by the US because of his warm personality.

item.title: 'Oga Sabinus Is My Father'
item.description: One of the popular faces in Oga Sabinus skit, Ukenwor Faith Ikechi, also known as Nduka, has opened up on his personal experience working with the AMVCA Award winner. Nduka stated that he went into skit making with Sabinus due to economic hardship. Speaking in an interview with Legit, Nduka explained that he has been working with Sabinus for years and it has been a splendid experience. In his words: “Sabinus is a friend, a father, a coach and a supporter.

item.title: 50 Dead As Terrorists Attack Zamfara Communities
item.description: Bandit terrorists have reportedly killed fifty persons during an attack on three communities in Bakura Local Government Area of Zamfara State. Naija News gathered that gunmen invaded Sabon Garin Damri, Damri and Kalahe communities on Friday afternoon and killed the residents including security operatives. The daredevils also injured several residents of the three communities and burnt down many houses during the invasion. According to Premium Times, the terrorists eventually retreated after security operatives reinforced and engaged them in a fierce battle.

item.description: Did SWV and Xscape tour together? The prominent R&B stars fought over the headliner for their tour on ‘SWV & Xscape: Queens of R&B.’ Source: BravoFans of ‘90s R&B music have been living their best nostalgic lives thanks to Bravo’s SWV & Xscape: Queens of R&B. On the show, the group discussed their plans for a joint tour.

item.title: Election Petitions Wasted Tinubus First Seven Months PDP Spokesman
item.description: The National Publicity Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Debo Ologunagba, has advocated for a significant amendment to Nigeria’s constitution regarding the inauguration of newly-elected presidents. In an interview with Punch on Wednesday, Ologunagba suggested that a president-elect should not be officially sworn into office until after the court has conclusively resolved all election-related petitions. This proposal comes in the wake of President Bola Tinubu’s administration, which, according to Ologunagba, faced substantial distractions during its first seven months due to ongoing election petition hearings.

item.title: Kiambu woman nursing injuries after Zuri sacco crew allegedly forced her to jump out of moving bus
item.description: A woman from Kiambu is nursing injuries she sustained after she threw herself out of a moving matatu following a scuffle between her and matatu crew from Zuri Sacco. Mercy Mwangi broke her leg, injured her head and back on Friday, May 24, after the crew changed route and refused to allow her to alight. READ ALSO: Meteorological department warns of heavy rainfall in parts of the country READ ALSO: Eight dead, six injured as Modern Coast bus collides with matatu According to her story narrated by advocate Mutichilo Mike, she boarded the bus heading to Kahawa West in the morning while on her way to work.

She attended the Tokyo School of Music with fellow band-mate Akane who originally asked her to play bass for the BAND-MAID group.

item.title: October 13 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: Your intellect, communication abilities and social skills combine nicely to give you the potential to succeed in a variety of careers. Your intellectual pursuits would be well-suited for a career in education, especially at the post-secondary level. Similarly, your natural abilities to communicate, paired with your capable mind would translate well to law or writing. If the entertainment world is more appealing, you may be a successful artist or singer, much like Ashanti, who was also born on October 13th.

item.title: APC Will Face Challenges When Buhari Leaves In 2023
item.description: Senate President Ahmad Lawan has voiced out his concern on what may happen to the All Progressives Congress (APC) after 2023. The Senate President noted that when President Muhammadu Buhari leaves office upon the completion of his tenure in 2023, APC will face the challenge of moving on without the ‘Buhari’ figure. Lawan made this view known on Monday night in a speech delivered to close the First Progressives Youth Conference 2021 at the International Conference Centre, Abuja.

item.title: Free Obi Cubana, Arrest APC's Tinubu Now Deji Adeyanju Tells EFCC
item.description: Popular Nigerian activist, Deji Adeyanju, has charged the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, EFCC, to arrest the All Progressive Congress, APC National leader, Bola Ahmed Tinubu. Naija News reports that the socio-political commentator made the call while appealing to the nation’s anti-graft agency to release popular socialite and billionaire businessman, Obinna Iyiegbu, better known as Obi Cubana. The activist bemoaned the continuous detention of the nightlife king who was apprehended on Monday over alleged money laundering and tax fraud.

item.title: Seplat Buys Shallow-water Business Assets From ExxonMobil For $1.283bn
item.description: Nigerian independent oil and gas company, Seplat Energy has agreed to purchase an equity interest in ExxonMobil Corporation’s shallow-water business, Mobil Producing Nigeria Unlimited (MPNU). Naija News reports that the Manager, Media and Communications, MPNU, Oge Udeagha, made this known in a statement issued on Friday. Udeagha disclosed that Seplat Energy agreed to buy the assets through its wholly-owned subsidiary, Seplat Energy Offshore Limited for $1.283 billion, adding that the transaction would close later this year pending regulatory approvals.

ACE (Assisting caring and empowering) charity is a non-profit organisation making a sustainable, realistic and effective difference in the lives of Africans.

item.title: 'Awa Lokan' - Tinubu Tells Super Eagles Of Nigeria Ahead Of 2023 AFCON Final
item.description: The President of Nigeria, Bola Ahmed Tinubu, has urged the Super Eagles to win the 2023 AFCON, reminding them that ‘Awa Lokan’. ‘Awa Lokan’ is a Yoruba phrase that means “it is our turn”, which was made more prominent by President Tinubu during the 2023 presidential campaign. Tinubu started the phrase with ‘Emi Lokan’, meaning it is his town to be Nigeria’s president after supporting former President Muhammadu Buhari to become president for two terms.

That first trimester, the only thing on your mind is ensuring that the baby's healthy. Then you've got all these ideas of what you want the sex to be and if you prefer the baby to be one sex over the other then you start thinking about what that says about you.

item.title: Monarch of Warri Denounces 500-year-old Tradition for Christ, Sparks Protests
item.description: Atuwatse II, the Olu of Warri, has announced he was giving the land where he rules to God and putting a stop to Idol worship. In a document titled “The New Order of Iwere Kingdom”, the monarch declared, “Henceforth, I submit and present the title ‘Ogiame’ to God, the creator, who made the sea and rules over all. Therefore, no Olu or person may bear the title or name that now belongs to God.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu Speaks On Ordering Sit-At-Home In South-East
item.description: The leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, on Tuesday, distanced himself from sit-at-home in the Southeast. IPOB initially ordered the sit-at-home in the Southeast to push for the release of its leader from detention by the Department of State Services (DSS). The order of the agitating group was, however, taken over by miscreants who employed the time to carry out illegal acts. Kanu, while speaking on sit-at-home in the region said rebels are behind the order in the region.

item.title: Ajimobi Reveals Buhari's Plan For Nigerians
item.description: Governor Abiola Ajimobi of Oyo State has described what the the victory of the President-elect, Gen. Muhammadu Buhari means for those who revel in cutting corners in the running of the affairs of Nigeria. The governor,  in a congratulatory message issued in Ibadan on Wednesday by his Special Adviser on Media, Dr. Festus Adedayo, said it means end of business as usual for those who revel in cutting corners in the running of the affairs of Nigeria.

item.title: Edo 2024: I'm Fully Independent, Not Obasekis Third Term Project
item.description: The governorship aspirant of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Edo State, Asue Ighodalo, has reiterated that his ambition is not backed by Governor Godwin Obaseki. Recall that on January 17, the former Chairman of Sterling Bank officially declared his intention to contest in the Edo State Governorship Election. Speaking during an appearance on Arise News on Wednesday, Ighodalo said he is independent and not backed by the governor. The PDP chieftain asserted that Obaseki could not compel him to do it as his third-term project because the governor had not informed him of any such plan.

item.title: Is Elizabeth Holmes Eligible for Parole? Her Jail Time Explained

item.title: 10 Things You Should Know About Biafra And The Biafran War
item.description: In recent times, there has been a renewed agitation for the Republic of Biafra by members of the Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB). Nearly 50 years after the Biafran War (July 6, 1967 – January 15, 1970) which almost destroyed the unity of Nigeria, its agitators have refused to give up the struggle. This struggle by some Igbo people to secede from Nigeria started when on May 30, 1967, late Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu, a military officer and politician announced a breakaway of the Eastern Region under the new name Republic of Biafra.

item.title: Lest Tainted RECs Undermine Credibility Of 2023 Election
item.description: As the May 29, 2023 handover date draws nearer, many Nigerians have apparently given up on President Muhammadu Buhari finishing strong in anti-corruption, neither do they see him triumphing over insecurity nor bequeathing a healthy economy. These are the three pillars upon which his administration has hinged since coming into the scene. Although Buhari may be forgiven for disowning the numerous promises he and his party men made as they pounded soapboxes across the country in the build-up to the 2015 election, the President owned up to the above three, yet all indices point to the federal government’s parlous performance in those critical areas.

item.title: February 22 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: Your gifts for compassion and communication will create a variety of career opportunities for you to explore, although choosing one may be easier said than done. Similarly, your gifts for expression may lead you to a career in writing, journalism or poetry. item.description: Third baseman who was drafted by the Chicago Cubs with the second overall pick in the 2013 MLB Draft. item.description: Stephanie Otobo, the alleged estranged lover of prominent pastor Apostle Johnson Suleman of Omega Fire Ministry Worldwide, was on Thursday, March 9, released from the Kirikiri Medium Security Prison. According to a report on Sahara Reporters, Otobo was released alongside Wisdom Godstime, a Canadian resident with whom she was detained after being accused of “terrorism.” Canadian based singer Stephanie Otobo had accused Apostle Suleman of getting her pregnant and dumping her afterwards.

item.title: Nat Turner - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Slave whose courageous act of leading a slave rebellion in Virginia on August 21,1831 unfortunately resulted in the adoption of new laws limiting the freedom of slaves. The rebelling slaves killed around 60 white people, but over 100 slaves were later killed by white militias as revenge. Before Fame He claimed that he received a vision in 1831, which convinced him that rebelling against his slave owners was his destiny.

item.title: 'Social Media Wasnt A Menace When You Used It To Address Govt As Vagabond'
item.description: Nigerian skitmaker cum political activist, Debo Adebayo, popularly known as Mr Macaroni, has slammed President Bola Tinubu’s Chief of Staff, Femi Gbajabiamila, for calling social media a menace. Naija News reported that Gbajabiamila, during a book launch in Lagos State on Thursday, February 8, 2024, berated the menace of social media in disseminating fake and wrong information, which has almost torn the country apart and caused violence in some states. He stressed the need to regularize the framework of news dissemination on social media to avoid misinformation in the country.

item.title: Allies Pressuring Atiku To Move Against Makinde, Ortom, Others Metuh
item.description: A former spokesperson of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Olisa Metuh, has claimed that the PDP Presidential Candidate, Atiku Abubakar, is under pressure to withdraw support for allies of loyalists of Nyesom Wike running election. According to Metuh, the former Vice President is resisting pressures to pull the rug from under the feet of Wike’s loyalists. Recall that the Wike camp had vowed not to partake in Atiku’s campaign activities pending the resignation of the party’s National Chairman.

item.title: I Will Never Come Back To Partisan Politics
item.description: 2023: Falae Condemns Call For Zoning The former National Chairman of the Social Democratic Party (SDP), Olu Falae, on Friday said there is no provision for zoning in the Constitution of Nigeria. Falae stated this while reacting to the call for the presidency to be shifted to the South-East in the 2023 general elections. The former minister of finance condemned the call for zoning during a visit by the executives of the Ondo State chapter of the party in Akure.

item.title: Maneet Chauhan - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Perhaps known best as a judge on the Food Network's Chopped, Chauhan is also famous for holding executive chef positions at the Chicago restaurant Vermilion and its New York branch, At Vermillion. In 2014, she opened a Nashville restaurant called the Chauhan Ale and Masala House. Before Fame After earning a degree from India's WelcomGroup Graduate School of Hotel Administration, she trained at the Culinary Institute of America. She went on to hold culinary apprenticeships with the Taj, Sheraton, and Oberoi companies in her native India.

item.title: Minister says Boko Haram will be defeated in 3 months
item.description: - The Nigerian defence minister has spoken out about Boko Haram  - Mansure Dan Ali believes the terrorists will be wiped out in just three months  - Boko Haram has retreated into the Sambisa forest which the Nigerian military is currently assaulting The Nigerian defence minister Mansure Dan Ali claims Boko Haram will be vanquished from its final stronghold in the Sambisa forest within three months. Mansur Dan Ali said on Wednesday that President Muhammadu Buhari had changed the game in the battle against Boko Haram, despite the group having pledged allegiance to ISIS.

item.title: Crisis Rocks APC As National Secretary Threatens National Vice Chairman, Demands N500 Million
item.description: The National Secretary of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Iyiola Omisore has asked for the payment of N500 million from vice-chairman of the party in the north-west, Salihu Lukman, over alleged libel. Naija News reports that Omisore and Lukman, who are both members of the national working committee (NWC) of the ruling party, have been at loggers. Speaking on Tuesday during an interview on AIt, Lukman had called on Omisore to resign from his position.

item.title: Wabunge wazua kioja baada ya kushindwa kuzungumza kiswahili
item.description: Kicheko kilishuhudiwa bungeni Ijumaa, Novemba 1, wakati wa mjadala wa mswada wa naibu Spika Moses Cheboi ambao unapendekeza Kiswahili kiwe kikitumika kwenye michango ya bungeni. Katika mchango wake, Cheboi alianza kwa utani baada ya kumpa kiongozi wa wengi Aden Duale kamusi ambapo atakuwa akirejelea anapofanya mchango kwa kutimia kiswahili. Habari Nyingine: Mariga alazimika kuenda mjengo katika mbinu za kusaka kura Duale aliamka kufanya mchango wake huku akiwa na Kamusi yake pamoja na daftari zingine aliposoma aliyokuwa akitaka kuchangia.

item.title: Atiku Abubakars Running Mate Emerges
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) is set to announce Governor Ifeanyi Okowa of Delta State as the running mate of its presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar. It was gathered that the announcement of Okowa as the PDP’s running mate would be made in the next few hours. According to Arise TV, the PDP and Atiku have settled for Okowa.

item.title: A Study of 10,000 Protests This Year Found that 95% of Them Were Peaceful
item.description: A Massive Study Found That 95% of Protests This Year Were PeacefulBy Robin ZlotnickUpdated Sept. 16 2020, 3:51 p.m. ET A massive protest movement against police violence and for the Black Lives Matter erupted in the United States several months ago, sparked by the death of George Floyd at the hands of Minneapolis police officers. Since then, opponents of these essential demonstrations have dismissed them as violent and threatening. The news has been filled with instances of looting, and indeed some protests, notably those in Portland, Oregon, and Kenosha, Wisconsin, have turned violent thanks to unidentified law enforcement agencies seizing people in the streets and vigilante killers murdering innocent demonstrators in the streets.

item.title: 'Jonathan Has Not Indicated Interest In Joining 2023 Presidential Race'
item.description: A former Minister of Aviation, Osita Chidoka, has said former President Goodluck Jonathan is yet to indicate interest in the 2023 presidential race. He stated that if the former president was interested in the presidency he would come out to tell Nigerians his intentions. Speaking in an interview on Arise TV,  Chidoka said Jonathan does not need to be convinced or pushed by anyone to succeed President Muhammadu Buhari. According to the former minister, during his last discussion with Jonathan the former president never indicated any interest in the nation’s number one seat despite him (Jonathan) being in a good place to seek re-election.
