item.title: Mikel Arteta Reacts To Links With Manchester United
item.description: The manager of Arsenal, Mikel Arteta has reacted against the speculation that he could be the successor of Erik ten Hag at Manchester United. Former Manchester United defender, Rio Ferdinand, started the speculation that if Manchester United approached Mikel Arteta to succeed Ten Hag, the Spanish tactician would abandon Arsenal for Old Trafford. Ferdinand sees Mikel Arteta as the potential manager of Manchester United due to how he has been able to make Arsenal a consistent contender for the Premier League title in the last two seasons.

item.title: Tinubu To Travel To Kenya For AU Meeting
item.description: President Bola Tinubu is set to travel to Nairobi, Kenya on Saturday, July 15. The president’s purpose is to attend the Fifth Mid-Year Coordination Meeting (5thMYCM) of the African Union (AU), an event that brings together various regional organizations and AU member states. As the Chairperson of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), President Tinubu will present a report at the meeting. It will outline the progress of regional integration in ECOWAS, detailing actions taken by its institutions, member-states, and other stakeholders in areas like trade, free movement of persons, investment promotion, and security.

item.title: FG Orders Probe Of Nigerian Private Universities
item.description: The Federal Ministry of Education, under the guidance of the Federal Government, has inaugurated a committee to scrutinize the activities of private universities established in Nigeria in the last 15 years. This announcement was made by the Minister of Education, Prof. Tahir Mamman, on Tuesday. The primary focus of this committee will be to evaluate whether these private institutions have adhered to the required standards, including the presence of prescribed facilities, an adequate management structure, and sufficient funding for their programs.

item.title: Armed robbery/kidnapping: Cross River to reward whistleblowers with N1m
item.description: - Cross River state governor, Prof Ben Ayade, has promised a sum of N1 million for anyone who offers information leading to the arrest of armed robbers and kidnappers in the state - The governor said the government would no longer allow people who were arrested on issues relating to armed robbery or kidnapping to find their way back to streets without prosecution Cross River state governor, Prof Ben Ayade, has announced a whistle blowing law in the state that guarantees the reward of N1 million for anyone who offers information leading to the arrest of armed robbers and kidnappers in the state.

item.title: Nursing Student Commits Suicide In Ogun
item.description: A 300-level student at a private tertiary institution in Abeokuta, Ogun State, identified as Ajoke, has committed suicide over an unwanted pregnancy. Naija News learnt that Ajoke, a student of Basic Medical Science at Havarde College of Science, Business and Management Studies, Abeokuta, reportedly drank a poisonous substance, suspected to be Sniper on Monday evening. A source who spoke to Daily Trust said the deceased had been battling depression, and her condition worsened after discovering that her course had not been accredited by the Nursing and Midwifery Council of Nigeria.

item.title: Taliban: Nigeria Winning The War Against Boko Haram
item.description: Nigeria’s Minister of Information and Culture, Alhaji Lai Mohammed has proudly declared that Nigeria is winning the war against Boko Haram and other terrorists. Citing the example of the Taliban in Afghanistan, Mohammed noted that ideological wars are not easy to fight and win but Nigeria is definitely having the upper hand and progress is being made. He debunked claims that Nigeria is becoming a failed state due to the activities of bandits, kidnappers, and other criminals, submitting that some of the terrorists have been submitting to government troops.

item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has identified some of the key ongoing projects in the country that must be completed before his tenure expires in 2023. The President listed the Second Niger Bridge, Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, Abuja – Kaduna – Zaria – Kano Expressway, and the East-West Road as some of the major projects that his administration is looking at delivering before vacating office. The President added that apart from the highlighted ones, other key projects under the Presidential Infrastructure Development Fund (PIDF) are also expected to be delivered.

item.title: President Tinubu Returns From Benin Republic
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has returned to Abuja after attending the 63rd anniversary of the Republic of Benin in Cotonou. Recall that Tinubu and his entourage, who left Nigeria on Tuesday morning, were received by Benin Republic President, Patrice Talon and key government officials. The Nigerian leader was accompanied on the one-day visit by some of his political aides and six governors which include Babajide Sanwo-Olu (Lagos); Seyi Makinde (Oyo); AbdulRahman AbdulRasaq (Kwara); Nasir Idris (Kebbi), and Mohammed Umar Bago (Niger).

item.title: Boko Haram Throws Maiduguri Into Darkness, Cuts Off Power Supply

This led to heavy military escort as repairs progressed. Residents and business owners now have to rely on their power generating sets for electricity.

But I'm trying to transition my hateration into something positive and that's by actually doing something with myself. There's no better way of feeling superior to someone (if that's what really gets you off) by demonstrating why you're superior. So by creating something beautiful, witty, and entertaining, or getting in better shape than someone, or just doing anything that's difficult that they can't do, that's turning hating into an art.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu Reacts To Court Victory Over Buhari Govt
item.description: The leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, has expressed happiness over the ruling of the Abia High Court. On January 19, Justice Benson Anya had ruled that the military raid on Kanu’s residence at Isiama, Afaraukwu Ibeku, Abia State, on September 10, 2017, was illegal and unconstitutional. The presiding judge added that the invasion amounts to an infringement on his right to life, dignity of his person, his personal liberty and fair hearing.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Friday, 1st March, 2024
item.description: Good morning Nigeria. Welcome to the Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today, Friday, 1st March 2024 President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has warned protesting labour unions in the country against causing unrest. Naija News reports that the Nigerian leader gave the warning in his speech on Thursday during the inauguration of the Red Line Rail Project in Lagos. Tinubu, who said he watched how people are demonstrating across the country over the ongoing hardship, said that unions must not hide under the guise of human rights to cause unrest.

item.title: Dokubo Seeking Favour Through Criticism Of Nnamdi Kanu
item.description: The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) denounced ex-militant leader, Asari Dokubo’s advice to President Bola Tinubu regarding the continued detention of Mazi Nnamdi Kanu, a pro-Biafran leader. The group lambasted Dokubo for suggesting that the president should not release Kanu, suggesting that Dokubo was merely trying to secure an oil contract by using Kanu’s name as a bargaining chip. IPOB’s spokesperson, Emma Powerful, stated on Sunday accusing Dokubo of exploiting the situation with Kanu to obtain an ‘oil guard’ contract from the Federal Government.

item.title: EPL Referee, Kevin Friend Suspended Over Controversial Liverpool Penalty
item.description: The English Premier League has reportedly suspended one of its referees, Kevin Friend, over controversial match officiating. Naija News understands that the 50-year-old UK-born has not been assigned any match to officiate for the next round of the EPL fixtures. The development is coming following Friend’s decision while officiating the game between Liverpool and Crystal Palace, which saw the Reds win 3-1 at Selhurst Park. With the score at 2-1, Liverpool’s forward Diogo Jota raced clear and bundled into Palace goalkeeper Vicente Guaita with minutes remaining.

item.title: Masari Reveals Why Youths Take To Crime, Identifies What Governors Must Do
item.description: Katsina State Governor, Aminu Bello Masari, said many youths get involved in criminal activities because states have failed to maximize mineral resources they are sufficiently endowed with. Naija News understands that Masari stated this on Monday when he paid a courtesy visit to the Minister of Mines and Steel Development, Architect Olamilekan Adegbite in Abuja. The Governor noted that the agitations for resource control and restructuring would be out of fashion when the nation’s other resources, such as solid minerals, are fully exploited and harnessed.

item.title: Former Presidential Candidate Defects To APC
item.description: Former presidential candidate, Gbenga Olawepo-Hashim, has dumped the Peoples Trust and defected to the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC). What is democracy?When we learned about democracy at school, it was described to us as the condition when people can freely speak their mind and elect the government, as well as participate in everyday life of the country.

item.title: 10th National Assembly To Be Inaugurated Tuesday
item.description: The Clerk to the National Assembly, Sani Tambawal in an announcement revealed that the 10th National Assembly of Nigeria is set to be inaugurated on Tuesday, June 13, 2023, at 10:00 a.m. Senators-elect and House of Representatives members-elect are asked to bring copies of their code of conduct clearance, certificates of return, and valid identity cards to the Senate and House of Representatives conference rooms for registration on Monday, June 12, at 10:00 am.

item.title: Popular Actor, Aminu Bono Is Dead
item.description: Popular Kannywood actor and director, Aminu Bono is dead. The actor’s colleague, Babangida Bangis, revealed that Bono died on Monday evening. Bangis said the filmmaker “collapsed” and was taken to the hospital where the doctors confirmed his death. He further stated that the deceased would be buried on Tuesday according to Muslim rites. Bangis said, “He was not sick. In fact, we were supposed to meet earlier today. “After we spoke on the phone, I was later told that he collapsed and was rushed to the hospital.

item.title: "This Time Around Is Different"
item.description: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar has expressed confidence about clinching the 2023 presidential ticket of the Peoples Democratic Party and going ahead to win the 2023 presidency during the general election. Atiku expressed the optimism and confidence on Wednesday as he officially declared interest in joining the race for the 2023 presidency at the International Conference Centre in Abuja. According to him, he has all the qualities that Nigeria needs in a leader and he is offering himself to serve as the next President of the country.

item.title: Twitter Reacts To Suspension Of Operation In Nigeria
item.description: Microblogging platform, Twitter has reacted to the decision of President Muhammadu Buhari-led government to suspend its operations in Nigeria. Twitter’s Senior Policy Communications Manager for Europe, Middle East and Africa, Sarah Hart, in a statement on Friday said the company is investigating the development. “The announcement made by the Nigerian Government that they have suspended Twitter’s operations in Nigeria is deeply concerning. “We’re investigating and will provide updates when we know more,” the statement said.

item.title: NADDC DG, Osanipin, Condemns Killing Of Monarchs, Abduction Of Pupils In Ekiti
item.description: The Director-General of the National Automotive Design and Development Council (NADDC), Oluwemimo Joseph Osanipin has vehemently condemned this heinous act that took the lives of Oba David Ogunsakin, the Elesun of Esun-Ekiti, and Oba Olatunde Olusola, the Onimojo of Omojola-Ekiti. The royal fathers fell victim to armed assailants on Monday night, between Oke-Ako and Ipao-Ekiti in Ajoni Local Government Area. The unfortunate incident occurred as they were returning from a security meeting in Irele-Ekiti.

item.title: Trouble As Court Nullifies All PDP Primaries In Ogun State
item.description: The 2023 primary elections held by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Ogun State have been nullified in their entirety. This is as Justice O.O Oguntoyinbo of the Federal High court sitting in Abeokuta, the state capital on Tuesday, ordered a fresh rerun of primaries by the PDP within 14 days. The court order nullifies the governorship, Senate, House of Representatives and the House of Assembly primaries conducted by the party.

item.title: Tinubu Reveals Theme For His Presidential Campaign
item.description: The National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu, has revealed the theme for his 2023 presidential campaign. Tinubu, who recently declared his 2023 presidential ambition, said the theme of his campaign is titled ‘Breaking Shackles.’ While addressing women members of the All Progressives Congress on Tuesday, Tinubu said his government will break the shackles of poverty and ignorance. The former Lagos governor promised that his administration if he eventually emerges would pay for students West African Examination Council Exams (WAEC).

item.title: 'I Feel Ashamed To Talk, Because Buhari Has Talked And Failed'
item.description: The Labour Party (LP) vice presidential candidate, Yusuf Baba-Ahmed has knocked the current administration of President Muhammadu Buhari, over the failure to deliver his campaign promises to Nigerians. Speaking during an interview on Channels TV, Peter Obi’s running mate said, he and the party’s candidate have the solutions to solve the insecurity challenges in the country but would rather act instead of talking. According to Yusuf, Nigerians are tired of hearing people talk and do the opposite, the reason he and Peter Obi are completely different from other politicians.

item.title: APC Move Against Bola Tinubu Presidential Ambition, Plot Consensus Candidate
item.description: Opposition groups in the All Progressives Congress (APC) are reportedly working underground to frustrate the yet to be officially announced presidential bid of Bola Ahmed Tinubu. Naija News reports that the ruling APC had settled for a consensus option for the emergence of party officials at all levels. In a statement last Wednesday, Secretary of the Caretaker/Extraordinary Convention Planning Committee (CECPC) of the party, Senator John Akpanudoedehe, said the reason for the decision is to reduce acrimony ahead of the forthcoming congresses.

item.title: Biafra: Southern Politicians Ready To Sell Their Souls For 2023 Presidency
item.description: Nnamdi Kanu, the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), has lamented that southern politicians are ready to sell their souls for the 2023 Presidency. Naija News reports that the IPOB leader who has been agitating for the Biafra Republic warned that “won’t happen because the Fulani have made it clear that they will keep the Presidency forever.” This online news platform understands that the IPOB who doubles as the Director of Radio Biafra, made this comment on the micro-blogging site, Twitter, on Saturday, November 14.

item.title: Details Of Obasanjo's Meeting With Three PDP Govs Emerges
item.description: Former President, Chief Olusegun Obasanjo, on Monday, played host to three State Governors elected on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP. The closed-door meeting Naija News understands was held at the elder statesman’s residence in Abeokuta, Ogun State capital. In attendance at the meeting were the Governor of Rivers State, Nyesom Wike, Governor Seyi Makinde of Oyo and Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue State. Former Governor of Cross River Governor, Donald Duke also was present at the meeting, Naija News reports.

item.description: Khaby Lame is a Senegalese-born Italian TikToker and social media influencer. He is known for his TikTok videos where he quietly mocks overly complicated life hack videos, remaking them into his own version. Also, many famous personalities have given positive reviews about him and his success. Furthermore, Lame is the second most followed TikToker in 2021. He has won millions of hearts for his humorous facial expression and silence, which he also attributes to him.

item.title: Trevor Wagner - Age, Family, Bio
Why I Turned Down Offer To Participate In BBNaija All-Stars
item.description: Former Big Brother Naija 2019 Housemate, Tacha has given her reason for not participating in the on-going ‘All-Stars’ reality show. Naija News reports that selected housemates from previous editions of the show, like Mercy, WhiteMoney, Venita, Neo, Ike, Cee-C, Cross, Angel and Alex, Seyi, Kiddwaya, among others, returned to the reality TV show on Sunday. Speaking about her absence after former colleague, Mike Edwards replied media personality, Toke Makinwa’s question on  housemates that should have been added, but wasn’t; the social media influencer said that the organizers of the show had refused to pay her to come back.

item.title: Causes of drought in Kenya, its effects & solutions
item.description: Drought is defined as long periods without rain which leads to a shortage of water among other adverse effects on the earth. Drought in Kenya has always been a problem. It's effects have been on the rise in the recent past. Understanding the causes of drought, how it affects the community and how we can stop it down is the first step to dealing with this year in year out menace.

item.description: Actor who replaced Brendan Fraser as the titular character in George of the Jungle 2. He also starred in the films Bad Day and Sea of Fear. Before Fame He majored in music at Michigan State University, moving to Hollywood after graduation. Trivia He had small parts in 1997's Super Troopers and the 2000 comedy Best in Show. And he directed his debut film, Radio America, in 2013. Family Life He was born and raised in Jackson, Michigan.

item.title: Dusty Baker - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Former MLB outfielder who went on to become an accomplished manager in the league. He served as the manager of the San Francisco Giants from 1993 to 2002, and later went on to manage the Chicago Cubs, Cincinnati Reds and Houston Astros. He won a World Series title as a player with the Los Angeles Dodgers in 1981 and he earned his first World Series title as a manager with the Astros in 2022.  Before Fame He played for the Atlanta Braves during his MLB career.

item.title: Gov Abiodun's Aide Indicted For Wire Fraud, Identity Theft
item.description: The suspended aide of Governor Dapo Abiodun of Ogun State, Abidemi Rufai who was arrested May 14, 2021, at JFK Airport in New York, has been indicted for conspiracy, wire fraud, and aggravated identity theft. Acting U.S. Attorney, Tessa M. Gorman, said Rufai was indicted for his scheme to steal over $350,000 in unemployment benefits from the Washington State Employment Security Department. Gorman added that Rufai will remain in detention at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York.

Naija News reports that this positive sentiment continued yesterday, with the market capitalization reaching N42.429 trillion on Wednesday, compared to the N40.917 trillion it opened with on Tuesday. The gains were primarily driven by Tier-1 banks such as Zenith Bank which rose by 4.

She earned three Oscar nominations by 25 before a tragic accident claimed her life at 43. item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Saturday, 29th January, 2022
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Saturday, 29th January 2022. As of the time of writing, almost 60,000 petitioners have joined Policy Shapers in seeking an end to the imposition of English Language proficiency test on every Nigerian seeking to study or migrate to the United Kingdom and some advanced countries. In the petition addressed to the Home Secretary of the United Kingdom, Priti Patel, the collective of campaigners argued that the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) should not be required of Nigerians given that their country is predominantly English speaking.

item.title: What Happened to Rooster Teeth? The Company Is Shutting Down
item.description: Rooster Teeth Is Being Shut Down After More Than 20 Years of Content Creation and ControversiesSeveral public controversies and a shrinking audience base all led to Rooster Teeth's imminent end. By Callie (Carlos) CadornigaMar. 7 2024, Published 11:26 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesWhen you think of the current internet culture of content creation, professional YouTubers, and playing video games for a living, you might think of Rooster Teeth. Having been originally founded on April 1, 2003, the company would essentially lay the groundwork for the kind of internet content from which people can now make a living.

item.title: Ill Bury Oshiomhole, Weve Dealt With Him Gov Obaseki
item.description: The Governorship candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party in Edo State, Godwin Obaseki, has revealed that he will bury the former National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress, Adams Oshiomhole, if he emerges winner of the September 19 electoral process. The Edo State Governor stated this on Saturday during the closing moments of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, campaigns in Oredo local government. The PDP governorship candidate noted that forthcoming poll is about contesting with Oshiomhole.

item.title: Democracy Index 2012: Democracy is at a standstill. Nigeria ranks 120th.
item.description: It is not easy to build a sturdy democracy. Even in long-established ones, democracy can corrode if not nurtured and protected. The democracy index measures the state of democracy in 167 countries worldwide. The index is based on 60 indicators grouped in five different categories: - electoral process and pluralism, - civil liberties, - functioning of government, - political participation, - political culture. In addition to a numeric score and a ranking, the index categorizes countries as on of four regime types full democracies, flawed democracies, hybrid regimes, and authoritarian regimes.

Family Life He is the oldest of three siblings. He married Dreka Gates and he has children named Islah and Khaza.

item.title: Shiites: Investigate Burning of Police Vehicle
item.description: The Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), popularly known as Shiites, has called on the Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Mohammed Adamu, to investigate the burning of a police operational vehicle in Kaduna. Recall that members of IMN and policemen were invloved ina bloody clash on Saturday. The Islmaic group had claimed that a combined team of armed police and thugs killed three of its members in Kaduna State. In a petition written to the IGP and signed by President of the Movement’s Media Forum, Ibrahim Musa, charged Adamu to unravel the circumstances leading to the setting on fire of a Kaduna police command vehicle.

item.title: Will Cree Summer Replace Jenny Slate in 'Big Mouth'? Fans Hope So!
item.description: Fans Voice Their Support for Cree Summer to Take Jenny Slate's Role in 'Big Mouth'By Distractify StaffUpdated June 25 2020, 1:43 p.m. ET Source: GettyWith individuals calling for an end to police brutality and racism in our country, Hollywood's elite are now using their platforms to not just voice their support, but also spark change in their industry. item.title: Christian Navarro - Age, Family, Bio
Defender Mutes Critics With First Goal
item.description: Ajax defeated Volendam 4-2 away in the Dutch league on Saturday, with Super Eagles defender Calvin Bassey scoring his first goal for the team. The 22-year-old defender joined the Eredivisie side from Rangers last summer for the fee of 19 million pounds. Ajax captain Dusan Tadic had given them the lead on 17 minutes from the penalty spot when Bassey extended the lead to make it 2-0. Bassey last scored in a 4-0 victory over Falkirk in the Scottish League Cup on November 10, 2020, while playing for Rangers.

item.title: Former President Jonathan Gets New Appointment [Photos]
item.description: Former President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan has been appointed as the Chancellor of Cavendish University in Uganda, East Africa. In a ceremony on Thursday, the former Nigeria leader was officially inaugurated as the Chancellor of the university alongside his wife Patience Jonathan. Naija News understands that the appointment makes Jonathan the third chancellor of the university since its establishment. The late former President of the Republic of Zambia, Kenneth Kaunda, was the pioneer chancellor, and the late president of the United Republic of Tanzania, Benjamin Mkapa, was the second chancellor.

item.title: IGP Redeploys DIGs Frank Mba, Bala Ciroma, Inuwa, 17 Other AIGs [Full List]
item.description: The Inspector-General of Police, IGP Usman Baba Alkali Baba, has redeployed DIG Hafiz M. Inuwa, to head the Department of Logistics and Supply. Naija News reports that the Police boss also approved the redeployment of the recently promoted Deputy Inspectors-General of Police, DIG Bala Ciroma, and DIG Emeka Frank Mba to head the Department of Training and Development and the Department of Research and Planning respectively. This was made known in a statement on Saturday by the Force Public Relations Officer, CSP Muyiwa Adejobi.

item.title: Whitemoney Goes Back To His Roots, To Visit People Who Slept Under Ojuelegba Bridge With Him
item.description: Winner of Big Brother Naija Shine ya eye edition, Whitemoney, is set  to visit his ‘roots’ Ojuelegba on January 28, 2022. The reality star, who claimed to have lived many lives in one of the streets, took to his social media on Thursday to announce his plans to visit the people who had slept under the bridge with him during his days of little beginnings. The reality star also revealed that he will be returning to the area to see some old friends.

item.title: Do Not Join APC If You Don't Have Money
item.description: Governor Rotimi Akeredolu of Ondo State has asked only those ready to contribute financially to the All Progressives Congress (APC) to join the party. He stated this while speaking during a stakeholders’ meeting ahead of the party’s membership registration and revalidation exercise scheduled to commence on Tuesday across the 3009 polling units of the state. Speaking when receiving members of the committee from the National Secretariat which was led by Murphy Lawal, Akeredolu said no one should be persuaded to join the ruling APC.

item.title: 'PDP Is Zero In Your State, You're Threatening To Sanction Me'
item.description: Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike, has knocked a member of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Board of Trustees, Adamu Maina Waziri, over threats to sanction him following the crisis in the party. Naija News reports that Wike during a live media chat with select television stations in Port Harcourt on Friday opined that PDP has never won Yobe state since the inception of democracy in 1999. According to him, the opposition party had always scored zero in elections in the state and one of the problematic people in PDP is from Yobe State.

item.description: The Federal Government says it is getting closer to an agreement with Twitter to lift the suspension imposed on the micro-blogging site in Nigeria. Naija News reported that the Nigerian government on June 4 announced the indefinite suspension of Twitter operations in the country. Speaking with heads of global media companies on Friday in Washington DC, the Minister of Information and Culture, Lai Mohammed, said the government is doing its best to lift the suspension of Twitter in Nigeria.

item.title: Jonathans Ex-Chief Of Staff, Arogbofa Dies At 72
item.description: A ex-chief of staff to former president, Goodluck Jonathan, Jones Arogbofa, is dead Naija News gathered that he died at age 72. Arogbofa was said to have died on Saturday, February 10, though the circumstances surrounding his death remain unclear as of the time of filing this report. His family has also not issued any statement on his death at press time. But a former senator and founder of Silverbird Group, Ben Murray-Bruce, confirmed the news via X on Saturday where he wrote, “I am deeply saddened to hear of the passing of Brigadier General Jones Oladeinde Arogbofa (Rtd), the former Chief of Staff to former President Goodluck Jonathan.

The group said the Minister Labour and Employment, Chris Ngige, the Governor of Rivers State, Nyesom Wike, Anambra State Governor, Willie Obiano; and Igbo businessman, Emeka Offor, would pay for their satanic role in Kanu’s crisis. The Group had earlier accused the above names of betraying its leader due to their selfish interest.

item.title: Shekarau Loses Out As Supreme Court Upholds Gandujes APC Faction
item.description: The All Progressives Congress faction of the Kano State Governor, Abdullahi Ganduje has been upheld as the authentic faction in the state. The Supreme Court ruled against the faction loyal to the former Governor of the state, Ibrahim Shekarau on Friday. The five member panel of justice in its ruling which was read by Justice Inyang Okoro stated that the appeal against the earlier judgements of the Court of Appeal in Abuja lacked merit and is dismissed.

item.title: Terrorists Release 23 Remaining Abuja-Kaduna Train Victims Six Months After Abduction
item.description: The remaining 23 victims kept in captivity after the dreaded terrorist attack on an Abuja–Kaduna bound train on March 28, 2022, have been released on Wednesday, Naija News understands. Recall that scores of citizens were killed and abducted in the attack that happened in Katari, Kaduna State, Nigeria, over three months ago. The assailants had released some of the victims earlier, while they kept others in their den, making unfriendly demands from the federal government.

item.title: Those calling for restructuring are opportunists - Governor El-Rufai
item.description: - The Kaduna state governor has said that all those calling for restructuring of Nigeria are opportunists - Nasir El-Rufai said the President Muhammadu Buhari-led administration has done more restructuring in the country - He also said those agitating for restructuring are irresponsible The governor of Kaduna state governor Nasir El-Rufai has said that those calling for the restructuring of Nigeria are political opportunists and irresponsible. While speaking on Sunrise Daily, a Channels Television programme, El-Rufai said the President Muhammadu Buhari's administration in two years have done better than the past administration.

He became Lagos governor in January 1992 and remained at this position until November 1993. item.description: Known for her Gold medal-winning performance at the 2001 World Games, this professional pool player was widely recognized during the 1990s as the top female billiards player in the world. Trivia Playing on the "Black Widow" nickname given to her by friends and fans who admired her ability to metaphorically eat her billiards opponents alive, she penned a memoir titled The Black Widow's Guide to Killer Pool.

item.title: Muslim-Muslim Ticket: Even The Muslims Are Not Happy, Northern Christians Will Teach APC A Lesson
item.description: A popular clergyman in the north, Prophet Isa El-Buba who is the General Overseer of the Evangelical Outreach Ministries International in Jos, Plateau State has condemned the decision of the All Progressives Congress (APC) to field a Muslim-Muslim ticket for the 2023 presidential election. According to El-Buba, the decision of Asiwaju Bola Tinubu and the APC to pick Senator Kashim Shettima as the vice presidential candidate is highly insensitive and does not portray equity and fairness.

item.title: Amaechi Worked For Atiku, Doesn't Deserve To Be Picked As Minister By Tinubu
item.description: A prominent member and leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Rivers State, Chief Tony Okocha has declared that former Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi does not deserve to get any appointment from President Bola Tinubu. According to Okocha, both Amaechi and Senator Magnus Abe worked against Tinubu’s presidential ambition in Rivers State during the 2023 elections. He alleged that it is an open secret that Amaechi worked for the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) candidate, Atiku Abubakar, while Abe, who obtained the governorship ticket of the Social Democratic Party, supported the SDP flag bearer.

item.title: PENGASSAN Pickets NCDMB
item.description: The Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB) experienced a disruption in its industrial harmony on Tuesday when the Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria (PENGASSAN) decided to shut down operations at the NCDMB headquarters, known as the Nigerian Content Tower in Yenagoa, Bayelsa State. Naija News understands that two canopies were placed at the entry and exit gates to prevent workers from entering the building. As a result, several workers who had already resumed work were unable to access the premises and had to return home, while others waited in their cars.

item.title: Nigerians React To Buhari's Facial Expression As Presidential Aspirants Step Down For Tinubu
item.description: Some Nigerians have reacted to President Muhammadu Buhari’s facial expression as presidential aspirants step down for Bola Tinubu. Ibikunle Amosun, Kayode Fayemi, and Dimeji Bankole withdrew from the race and declared support for Tinubu at the ongoing presidential primary election. From the live broadcast, it seems Buhari is unhappy with the decision of the aspirants to step down for Tinubu especially after he had wanted to choose his successor. Reacting to the video, many Nigerians said Buhari is unhappy, while some are alleging that Tinubu might have bought the presidential aspirant with money.

item.title: 2023: 'I Will Never Support Tinubu'
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari’s Special Adviser on Political Matters, Babafemi Ojudu has revealed what he will do if his principal decides to support Bola Tinubu for presidency. According to Ojudu, he would go back to farming if Buhari choses the National Leader of the All Progressive Congress as his presidential candidate. Ojudu stated this during an interview with Chude Jideonwo. The presidential aide when asked if he would support Tinubu if President Buhari chooses him as his candidate said he would never.

The meeting held at the Edo State Government House, in Benin City and had in attendance Governors Douye Diri of Bayelsa; Sim Fubara of Rivers; Umo Bassey Eno of Akwa Ibom, and Sheriff Oborevwori of Delta State, represented by his Deputy, Monday Onyeme.

item.title: King Charles III Reacts As Floods Kills Hundreds, Displace Thousands In Nigeria
item.description: King Charles III of the United Kingdom has expressed his sympathy to the president of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari over the devastating flood that has killed over five hundred and left thousand of others displaced in many parts of the country in recent weeks. Naija News reports that King Charles III made this known in a letter that was published on the Royal Family’s website on Friday. According to the NASA Earth Observatory, “The rainy season in Nigeria was especially harsh in 2022, with heavy rains producing deadly, destructive floods in numerous states.

item.title: Lagos Assembly Speaker Obasa Wants Better Funding For Nigerias Health Sector
item.description: The Speaker of the Lagos State House of Assembly, Rt. Hon. Mudashiru Obasa, has mentioned poor funding of the health sector in Nigeria as a hindrance to the country’s attainment of the Universal Health Coverage (UHC) target of the World Health Organisation (WHO). Dr. Obasa spoke on Thursday at a 2-day health programme organised by the House in conjunction with the Legislative Advocacy Initiative For Sustainable Development (LISDEL). The programme is aimed at enhancing the capacities of legislators and key stakeholders in the health sector of Lagos state as part of moves to help Nigeria meet the universal health coverage.

item.title: My New Album Might Be My Last
item.description: Popular Nigerian singer, Olamide Adedeji, on Saturday disclosed that his new album is 95 percent ready. The award-winning singer who disclosed this on his Twitter account stated that he is not sure of when he would be releasing the album. According to Olamide, he is taking his time to ensure that his forthcoming album will be the best ever. He further stated that the album which he dubbed, ‘Unruly’ might be his last album, but he would drop singles once a while.

item.title: Osinachi's Husband May Get Death Penalty As FG Files Homicide Charges Against Him
item.description: The Federal Government has filed 23-count charges against the husband of late gospel singer, Osinachi Nwachukwu, Peter. Recall that the gospel singer died on the 8th of April after her husband allegedly assaulted her. The Attorney-General of the Federation charged Peter under sections 104 and 379 of the Administration of Criminal Justice Act, 2015. Peter was charged with culpable homicide contrary to section 221 of the Penal Code which is punishable with death.

Before Fame He suffered from epilepsy as a child, and began writing music at age seven. One of the first groups he worked with was 94 East. Trivia He became known for releasing over thirty Top Forty single hits and gained fame as an international sex symbol.

item.description: Center back who became captain for both Manchester City and the Belgium national team in 2011. He was named the Premier League Player of the Season in 2012. Before Fame He won the Belgian Golden Shoe and Ebony Shoe while playing at Anderlecht. Trivia He led Manchester City to a Premiere League title run in 2011-12, the club's first title in 44 years. Family Life His father Pierre became his agent. He has an older sister as well as a brother, François, who is a fellow soccer player.

item.title: Are They Back? Greenwood And Harriet Follow Each Other On Instagram
item.description: Manchester United forward, Mason Greenwood and his partner, Harriet Robson, appeared to be following each other again on Instagram. The Manchester United wonder kid quickly gained recognition across the globe as one of the Premier league’s best prospects. But an off-the-field event saw his partner upload a video of her allegedly being abused by the English forward on her Instagram story and accused Greenwood of sexual assault and rape. This video includes pictures and audio clips of their conversations to back up her claim.

item.title: I Am Happy Wike, Umahi Did Not Win Presidential Tickets
item.description: The presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP), Rabiu Kwankwaso has expressed excitement that the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike did not clinch the presidential ticket of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Recall that Wike was defeated by a former vice president, Atiku Abubakar in the presidential primary of PDP. Kwankwaso who described Wike and the Governor of Ebonyi State, David Umahi as performers were happy that Umahi also did not win the All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential ticket.

item.title: Opeyemi Bamidele Speaks On Plan To Dump APC
item.description: The Senator representing Ekiti Central in the National Assembly, Opeyemi Bamidele, has suspended his plan to dump the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC). In a statement he personally signed on Friday, Bamidele also said he has shelved the plan to drag the ruling party to court over the conduct of its primary election in the state. The former Lagos Commissioner reiterated that the primary election that produced Biodun Oyebanji as the party’s flag bearer in the upcoming governorship election is “a fraudulent and fictitious vote count”.

item.title: Ukraine Release Prison Inmates From Jail To Fight Russia
item.description: As fierce fighting continues across Ukraine, the President Volodymyr Zelensky has announced that his government will be freeing prisoners with military experience to join the battle against invading forces. President Zelensky made this known in a video address on Monday, Naija News reports. He revealed that inmates will be able to “compensate for their guilt in the hottest spots.” He announced that the prisoners will serve their debt to society on the front lines of the conflict with Russia

item.title: Wike: I'm Willing To Leave Office For Peace To Reign In Rivers State
item.description: Rivers State Governor,Sim Fubara, has expressed readiness to give up his position for peace to reign in the state. Naija News reports that Fubara made this known in an interview with AIT as the political crisis involving him and his predecessor cum Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Nyesom Wike, continues to linger. Recall that President Bola Tinubu intervened earlier in the matter and got Governor Fubara and Wike to sign an agreement to end the lingering political crisis, but the crisis seemed unabated.

item.title: Husband Beats His Wife Over Election Results
item.description: A commercial motorcyclist, Raphael Abiodun, yesterday cruelly beat his wife, Bose, over a disagreement on the outcome of the presidential and National Assembly elections. The Sun News reports that the couple, who live in Igangu area of Omu-Aran in Irepodun local government area of Kwara state, are members of different political parties. The result of the elections in the area was said to have created a frosty relationship between the husband and the wife.

item.title: Network Shutdown In Zamfara, Katsina Violates Human Rights
item.description: The Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project, SERAP, has condemned the shutting down of telecommunication services in Zamfara and Katsina State by the Federal Government. Naija News had reported earlier that President Muhammadu Buhari-led government ordered the shutting down of mobile networks in the two states over insecurity issues. The decisions follows a series of offensive attack on bandit terrorists by the Nigerian military in the northwest region. The affected Local Government Areas are affected by the development are listed as; Sabuwa, Faskari, Dandume, Batsari, Danmusa, Kankara, Jibia, Safana, Dutsin-Ma and Kurfi that are on the fringes of the Ruggu forest where most of the bandits are hiding.

Naija News reports that Abdulkareem, in the interview, spoke about his loggerheads with his colleague, Charly Boy, stating he is greedy and cannot be trusted with money. He claimed that he, alongside Blackface, influenced the music career of legendary singer, 2face Idiba and founded the defunct music group ‘The Remedies,’ which Eddy Remedy and Tony Tetuila later debunked.

item.title: After Weeks In Detention DSS Finally Releases Mama Biafra
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) has released Ukamaka Ejezie, popularly called Mama Biafra, who is said to be the foster mother of the detained leader of outlawed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Mazi Nnamdi Kanu. Naija News reports that Mama Biafra, who has been in the DSS detention for several weeks, on Sunday regained her freedom from the custody of security agencies. Mama Biafra’s release was confirmed in a statement by Nnamdi Kanu’s lead counsel, Ifeanyi Ejiofor.

item.title: April 11 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: The Aries is under the planetary rule of Mars, but as you were born in the third Decan, or part, of the sign, you also receive a generous helping of Jupiter's planetary power. While it is the power of Mars that is responsible for your assertiveness, action and vigor, it is the special influence of Jupiter that contributes to your optimism, generosity and desire for truth. More so than any of the Aries Decans, your planetary influence makes you interested in learning.

item.title: Ban bar harkar fim don na fi karfinta ba, Fati Muhammad ta bayyana dalilinta na barin Kannywood
item.description: - Shaharrariyar tauraruwar fina-finan Kannywood Fati Muhammad ta amsa wasu tambayoyi kan abubuwan da suka shafi rayuwarta - A tattaunawar da aka yi da ita, Fati ta bayyana cewa ta bar masana'antar shirya fina-finan Hausa ba don ta fi karfinta ba, illa don shekaru da lokacinta da suka ja baya - Ta kuma bayyana cewa ra’ayi da kaddara ne suka sa ta tsunduma harkar siyasa a yanzu Shahararriyar tsohuwar jarumar nan ta Kannywood, Fati Muhammad ta bayyana abunda ya sa ta barin harkar fim.

item.title: COVID - 19: Farah Maalim ataka serikali kupiga marufuku uuzwaji na ulaji wa miraa
item.description: Aliyekuwa Naibu Spika wa Bunge Farah Maalim ameitaka serikali kupiga marufuku kwa muda uuzwaji na usambazaji wa miraa kama njia moja ya kukabiliana na virusi vya Corona. Maalim aliwataka magavana wa Garissa, Wajir, Mandera, Isiolo, Marsabit, Tana River, Lamu na Mombasa kushirikiana na kuhakikisha amri hiyo inatekelezwa ili kuzuia kusambaa kwa maradhi hayo Daily Nation iliripoti . Habari Nyingine: Corona haina huruma kwa waporaji wa mashamba na wezi asema Miguna Miguna

item.title: Deidre Hall - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress who became known for playing Dr. Marlena Evans on the soap opera Days of Our Lives. Before Fame She intended on becoming a psychologist before realizing her passion for acting. Trivia She became an Ambassador for Operation Smile. Family Life She married three times before her 1991 marriage to Steve Sohmer. She has two sons, Tully and David. Associated With She starred in the soap opera Days of Our Lives with Jensen Ackles.

item.title: Ebonyi Commissioners 'Melted Their Hearts Into Mine' Gov Umahi
item.description: The Governor of Ebonyi State, Engr. David Umahi, has disclosed that those serving at the highest echelon of his government aligned with his mindset, pointing out that this has led to the success of his administration. Naija News reports that he stated this on Wednesday when he received a former Governor of Borno State, Ali Modu Sheriff, who was in the state to make consultations on contesting for the national chairmanship position of the All Progressives Congress (APC).

item.title: Horia - Age, Family, Bio
I Didnt Write Electoral Act Alone
item.description: The Deputy Senate President and Delta State Governorship aspirant under the All Progressives Congress, Ovie Omo-Agege has denied writing the electoral act alone. Omo-Agege stated this during a consultative meeting in Ughelli North, Delta State. The lawmaker charged Nigerians to disregard the report making rounds that he wrote the electoral act alone. He further stated that Nigerians have been misinformed about the electoral act which was assented to by President Muhammadu Buhari.

item.title: Inspekta wa polisi akamatwa kwa madai ya kushiriki ngono na wavulana 6
item.description: Polisi mjini Chogoria, kaunti ya Tharaka Nithi, wamewaokoa wavulana sita ambao inaripotiwa walikuwa wamefungiwa nyumbani kwa inspekta wa polisi. Wavulana hao wamearifu polisi kuwa inspekta huyo wa kiume amekuwa akishiriki na wao mapenzi kwa lazima. Wako kati ya umri wa miaka 14-19 na polisi wameelezea kisa hicho kama jambo linaloweza kufanyika kwenye aina ya filamu pekee. Habari Nyingine: Bonface Kabaka: Seneta wa Machakos kuzikwa leo “Katika kile kinaweza kufanyika tu kwenye filamu, vijana hao waliokolewa usiku wa manane baada ya mkuu wa uchunguzi wa uhalifu kaunti ndogo ya Maara na mwenzake wa polisi kufika eneo la mkasa.

item.title: Isaias Afwerki - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: World leader who became the first President of the State of Eritrea in 1991 and was the leader of the Eritrean People's Liberation Front. Before Fame He graduated from Prince Makonnen High School in 1965. Trivia He became President of the National Assembly in 1993. Family Life He married Saba Haile and they have two sons and a daughter. Associated With He was friends with Meles Zenawi during the war for independence.

item.title: Jason Watkins - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: British actor of the stage and screen who was nominated for a Laurence Olivier Theatre Award in 2001 for Best Supporting Actor for his performance in A Servant For Two Masters. He won two British Academy Television Awards for his role in The Lost Honour of Christopher Jefferies and starred in the 2011-2014 series Trollied. Before Fame He trained at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art and became a member of the National Theatre company.

item.title: John Luke Robertson - Age, Family, Bio
Late MKO Abiolas Daughter, Tundun Abiola Converts To Christianity
item.description: Tundun Abiola, daughter of Late MKO Abiola who was married to Atama Shaka Atta before their marriage collapsed has converted to Christianity. She has also dropped her Muslim name Hawa, and now bears Victoria. Sources claim the conversion happened after Tundun and her ex-husband, Atama parted ways. The couple got separated last year after three years of marriage. Tundun's ex-husband, Atama Attah has re-married. He got married to Presidential aide,Josephine Washima.

item.title: Latest Political News In Nigeria For Today, Sunday, 11th September, 2022
item.description: Welcome to the round-up of the latest political news in Nigeria, political gist, highlights of political events, and happenings in Nigeria for today Sunday, 11th September 2022. Read all the major political news, political event highlights, and happenings in Nigeria for today on a single page right here. Reveal Person Backing Atiku In Presidency, Tinubu Group Tells Wike The Tinubu-Shettima Ambassadors (TSA) has asked Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State to reveal the name of the presidential aide backing the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar.

item.title: Newlywed Couple Joins Philly Protest Right After Getting Married
item.description: Dr. Kerry Anne Perkins and Michael Gordon got married while a protest passed by, so they decided to join in their gown and tux. Source: TwitterOn Saturday, June 6, Dr. Kerry Anne Perkins and Michael Gordon tied the knot at the Logan Hotel in Philadelphia while, at the same time, marching protesters passed by. So, they decided to join the protest — tuxedo, wedding gown, and all. According to The Philadelphia Inquirer, as the newlywed couple exited the hotel, they were greeted with cheers and applause from the protesters, who were in the midst of marching from the Philadelphia Museum of Art to City Hall.

item.title: NFF President, Pinnick Says He Is Stepping Down
item.description: The President of the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) Amaju Pinnick, has announced he is retiring in September 2022. Naija News understands that the 51-year-old had shown interest in a third term but the Super Eagles’ failure to qualify for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar watered down his bid. Recall that the Nigerian national football team on March 29, 2022, drew 1-1 with the Black Stars of Ghana in the return leg of the final round qualifiers for this year’s World Cup.

item.title: Rebecca McBrain: What happened to Paul Walker's ex-girlfriend?
item.description: Over seven years after the untimely death of film star Paul Walker in a car crash with his friend, the whereabouts of Rebecca McBrain, his ex-girlfriend, has been a subject of curiosity. The retired school teacher and servicewoman became famous due to her relationship with Paul that brought forth the actor's only daughter. Rebecca Soteros McBrain is the most popular of all girlfriends of the late Paul Walker. Rebecca McBrain andPaul Walker had a short-lived relationship in 1998.

item.title: Sara Ramirez - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actor best known for their role as Callie Torres on Grey's Anatomy, they also starred in You've Got Mail. They received a Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Musical for their portrayal of The Lady of the Lake in Spamalot. Before Fame They attended Juilliard and graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in 1997. Trivia They acted in Broadway plays before moving to television. Family Life They married Ryan DeBolt in 2012.

item.title: Top 7 Igbo worship songs and their lyrics
item.description: There are a large number of Christians in Nigeria and amongst them, many are Igbo by tribe. Most of these worshippers often sing several songs in their mother tongue that a lot of people have come to like. But a lot of people do not know how to properly sing these songs because they do not know the lyrics. As a result of this, Legit.ng has curated a list of seven of the most popular Igbo worship songs.

item.title: US To Return $8.9 Million Looted Under Jonathan To Nigeria
item.description: A Royal Court in Jersey, United States, has delivered a ruling for the repatriation of stolen assets worth £6.9 million ($8.9 million) back to Nigeria. This decision comes in the wake of allegations that the funds were misappropriated by Nigerian government officials in 2014 under the pretext of purchasing arms to combat Boko Haram terrorists. The BBC reported that the court determined the money, held in a Jersey bank account, was likely embezzled by officials in the Nigerian government in 2014.

item.title: What Is a Durast in 'Shadow and Bone'? Here's What to Know
item.description: In 'Shadow and Bone,' magical beings called Grisha can manipulate the elements. What is a Durast, and what can they do? Here's the scoop. In the fantastical world created by Leigh Bardugo that has become Netflix's Shadow and Bone, magic users known as Grisha can manipulate matter at will, known as the "Small Science." Depending upon which element you draw from determines your order in the Grisha and your matching colored kefta.

item.title: Why Doesn't David Dobrik Drink? He Has Personal Reasons for Abstaining
item.description: Why Doesn't David Dobrik Drink? The YouTube Star Knows His Limits With AlcoholBy Michelle SteinUpdated Aug. 17 2020, 4:06 p.m. ET Source: Ilya S. Savenok/GettyPlenty of people in this world enjoy alcohol — whether it's a glass of wine with dinner, grabbing a couple of beers while catching up with a friend, or the occasional all-out party. At the same time, there are also individuals who choose to abstain from alcohol for one reason or another.

item.title: Why We Moved Our Head Office To Lagos From Abuja
item.description: The Federal Airport Authority of Nigerian (FAAN) has explained why it moved its headquarters from Abuja to Lagos. Naija News reports that the federal airport authority had declared earlier on Thursday that it would relocate its headquarters to Lagos. The announcement, however, sparked mixed reactions among Nigerians. However, giving the reason for its decision to move its headquarters from Abuja to Lagos, FAAN Director of  Public Affairs and Consumer Protection, Obiageli Orah  explained that it decided to move the airport authority headquarters because the airport authority did not have an office space at the Federal Capital Territory.

item.title: xTurtle - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: YouTube gamer and Twitch live streamer with a primary focus on the game Minecraft. His YouTube channel has amassed over 140,000 subscribers. Before Fame He kicked off his YouTube career with a "xTurtle Official Intro!" video in May of 2015. Trivia His most popular videos on YouTube are part of his "Hacking in Minecraft" series. He has more than 10,000 followers on Twitch. Family Life He was born in Niskayuna, New York.
